loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo se dedica a la producción de leche; de la misma, elabora quesos y los comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un terreno para dar más espacio a sus vacas. Esta actividad es  la fuente de ingreso que tiene para la manutención de su hogar. El señor vive en casa propia en la comunidad de Kella Kella a un par de horas de la ciudad de El Alto; es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA .
texts.en: Pablo is a dairy farmer; he produces milk and makes cheeses that he sells in the city of La Paz. He needs the loan to buy land so his cows will have more space.  This activity his source of income for maintaining his home.  He lives in his own home in the community of Kella Kella, a couple of hours from the city of El Alto.  He is married and has two kids.  This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy land for his cows

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a  37-year-old married man with six children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He dreams of educating his children to attain a degree.

For five years he has been operating a drugstore.  With his savings, he has been able to pay school fees for his children.  He faces a challenge of high taxes levied on him.  His desire is to own a pharmacy.   Vincent is seeking the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell at his drugstore

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married woman living with her husband. She is from Lebanon. She has owned a home products sales shop since 2006. Because of her wide experience in this domain, this woman was able to expand her business operation by adding a small corner to her shop where she sells gadgets and originA. gifts. She cooperates with her husband who works in the Lebanese generA. security to maintain the family financiA. level at a good point.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her shop’s inventory. She is planning to buy particular products to attract a maximum number of customers in order to increase her sales and therefore her income. She is an ambitious woman with many plans in her mind concerning business improvement.

loans.use: to increase her shop’s inventory.

loans.name: Tuongozane Group

texts.fr: Kangesa K.  M. est entrepreneur, secrétaire du groupe d’affaire « Tuongozane »,  âgée de 44 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants dont 6 vont  à l’école. Son mari est un chômeur, sans emploi. La cliente Kangesa K.  M. est vendeuse des bananes. Elle exposeau marche central de Virunga.  Il ya 13 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec de fonds propre issu d’une petite commission de vente parcelle de son voisin. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des 80 régimes de bananes et la moitié sera affecté  à l’épargne. En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son capital, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison en dur.  La cliente Kangesa K.  M.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Tuongozane » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Kangesa K. M. is a businesswoman and secretary of the "Tuongozane" business group. She is 44 years old, married, and has 8 children, of whom 6 are in school. Her husband is currently unemployed. Kangesa K. M. sells bananas and displays her goods at the central market in Virunga. She has run this business for 13 years. She began her business with her own funds, issued by selling a small plot of land to her neighbour. This new loan will serve to supply her with 80 bunches of bananas, and the remaining half will be allocated to savings. In addition, her ambition is to enlarge her capital, educate her children, and construct a permanent home. Kangesa K. M. is thankful to Hekima (one of Kiva's field partners) for its actions on behalf of the poor who are excluded from the standard banking system. It is to be noted that the "Tuongozane" business group is composed primarily of women.

loans.use: to buy 80 bunches of bananas, and allocate the remaining half to savings.

loans.name: Peter Njoroge

texts.en: Peter is 65 years old, married and makes a living by running a restaurant with his wife. He has been in this business for 28 years and earns about 5,000 Kenyan shillings a month. He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying all of his previous ones on time. He plans to use this loan to pay for his daughter's school fees. In the future, he hopes to open a medical clinic for children who live in his area.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's school fees.

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Delicia pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo” del Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 47 años y tiene 03 hijos que aún estudian.

Ante la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos inicia  su negocio con la venta de zapatos, que muchas veces los vendía al crédito el mismo que no era pagado a tiempo por lo que perdió gran parte de su capital y  contando tan solo con un capital de S/. 300.00 decide cambiar de negocio y en la actualidad se dedica a la elaboración de chupetes (helados de hielo), refrescos y gaseosas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles comprará frutas  de la región y esencias naturales para la elaboración de chupetes, refrescos y con el dinero restante comprará agua mineral con gas y sin gas,  gaseosas de los diferentes sabores y tamaños para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

La Sra. Delicia   es una mujer fuerte y tiene como sueño contar con su negocio de refrigerios, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella que desean superarse.
texts.en:
Delicia is a member of "El Abiseo" Communal Bank, located in the Juanjui district and in the San Martín department. She is single, she is 47 years old and she has 3 children who still go to school.

Needing to have her own income, she started a retailing activity by selling shoes. She mostly sold on credit, but since this was seldom repaid on time she lost a good share of her capital. Therefore, counting only on a working capital of 300.00 PEN she decided changing activity, and right now she engages in selling chupetes (iced lollipops) she herself prepares as well as soft drinks and fizzy drinks.

This loan of 1500.00 PEN will be used to buy regional fruit and natural flavors to prepare chupetes and soft drinks, and with the remaining capital she will buy sparkling and still mineral water, as well as fizzy drinks of different flavors and sizes to continue attending her customers with the best care.

Delicia is a strong woman who dreams of counting on her cool drinks activity. She is deeply thankful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her who wish to excel in life.

loans.use: To buy regional fruits and natural flavors, mineral water and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 29 years old, married and has one child who is three months old. He has sold second-hand shoes for six years and has employed two people.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been economically empowered. He has requested 50,000 KES to add to his stock of rubber shoes. He hopes to establish his business fully and employ more people.

loans.use: To add to his stock of rubber shoes

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 28-year-old mother of two daughters and one son. Her husband is a construction worker in the land behind the Wall\ Green Line. Rania and her husband are building a house that they are investing in with all their savings.

Rania and her husband need $3,000 to finish the house and move in by the end of summer 2011. Rania took out the loan from FATEN to cover the finishing expenses.

Rania's husband is a partner in a goat farm which adds to their income.

Rania is a conservative woman therefore her brother is photographed instead of her.

loans.use: to pay the wages of construction workers who are finishing Rania's house.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Savorn, 38 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is an artist, he draws along the pagodas. Their income is 11.5 USD per day. They have two children, one is working in the factory and one more is an artist like his father. 

Every month, Savorn has to spend 60 USD on food and 20 USD on transportation. She would like to request a loan of 400 USD to buy drawing paint. She expects to save some money to buy grocery goods to sell in front of her house. More than that, she wishes to repair her house because it is not in good condition.

loans.use: to buy drawing paint

loans.name: Sam Im

texts.en:
Sam Im is a construction worker, while his wife, Chhean, is a garment worker. They have been married since 2000 and have two children, one son and one daughter. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sam Im is asking for a loan of $400 to add to his own money to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: to add to his own money to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Bertha Julia

texts.es: Bertha Julia  tiene hijos es casada se dedica a la venta D. medicinas D. OMILIFE,O medicina natural  su negocio es ambulante, también se dedica a la venta D. comidas por encargos, y por su puesto a la crianza D. animales; D. esas actividades ella obtiene ingresos. Solicita el crédito para la compra D. medicinas,  su sueño es tener un negocio estable o un local propio para poder vender sus medicinas y surtir su negocio con oros productos.por momento esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. medicina natural.
texts.en:
Bertha Julia is married and has children. She sells Omnilife natural medicines as a traveling vendor. In addition, she sells food upon request and raises animals to earn extra income.

Bertha needs a loan to buy medicines. Her dream is to have a stable business or her own shop where she can sell her medicines and other products. At the moment, she is requesting this loan to buy natural medicines.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 58-year-old single mother of eight children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Ever since she separated from her husband 20 years ago, she has been solely taking care of her family.  She is glad to have educated her children and now the last-born is in senior four. She earns a living from sewing sweaters, a business she has been doing for seven years now and her dream is to have at least three outlets in town. Margret needs the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
For the last six years, Jackson has been buying and selling livestock in Makueni town. He is 54 years old and married to Munyinya. They have been blessed with six children.

He was introduced to KADET by KADET staff. He has been loaned 30,000 Kenyan shillings. He intends to use the loan amount to buy two cows.

In the future, he hopes his business will grow and that he will be able to sell 10 or more cows per month.

loans.use: To buy two cows.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, 44 years old, has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. She is separated from her husband and now takes care of their two children, who are both in college.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Naomi hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kaay Bakh 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Kaay Bakh 5 est composé de 5 femmes qui habitent au Sénégal  et vivent dans la même localité. Elles exercent  toutes la même  activité de commerce et s’adonnent à la vente de poissons, de fataya, de bijoux, de draps et de parfums. Elles sont représentées par madame Khoudia  qui est très  expérimentée  dans la vente de poissons.  Elle passe toute sa journée  à son lieu de travail et ambitionne de mieux rentabiliser son activité. Le groupe est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de bijoux, parfums, farine et poissons  destinés a développer les activités de chaque membre du groupe, a  accroitre leurs bénéfices respectifs et  a améliorer  les conditions de vie sociale de ces dernières.
texts.en: The Kaay Bakh 5 group comprises five women who live in the same area in Senegal. They all run the same type of business and sell fish, fatayas (fish patties), jewelry, sheets, and perfume. The group is represented by Ms. Khoudia, who has extensive experience selling fish. She spends the whole day at her workplace and her ambition is to make her business more profitable. The group belongs to a local branch of U-IMCEC. The group members are seeking a loan of 500,000 Frs destined for the purchase of jewelry, perfume, flour, and fish in order to develop each member's business, increase their respective profits, and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish, fabric, jewelry, sheets, and perfume for resale.

loans.name: Sylvia Elena

texts.es: La señora Sylvia Elena tiene 32 años tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Tiene 6 años trabajando con este negocio y se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. En su vivienda cuenta con una pequeña vitrina donde exhibe ciertos productos. el crédito será utilizado para la compra de calzado, perfumes, ropa en general, prendas de plata, pinturas de labios y bolsos. Su dedicación es exclusiva porque el beneficio es para ella y su familia, por ello se esfuerza.
texts.en: Sylvia Elena is 32 years old and has two dependent children in her care.  She has been working in her business, selling general merchandise, for six years.  At home she has a small display case where she displays certain products.  She will use her loan to buy footwear, perfumes, clothes, silver jewelry, lipsticks and bags.  This business receives her complete commitment as the profit is for her and her family.  This is why she works hard.

loans.use: to buy footwear, perfume, clothes, silver jewelry, lipsticks and bags

loans.name: Taher

texts.en:
Taher is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He has 12 years of experience working as a farmer. In 2000, he bought a plot of land where he started to cultivate different types of vegetables and fruits according to the season. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds because he's planning to expand his business. He estimates that with the coming harvesting, his profits will increase.

loans.use: to buy new farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 40-year-old married man with four children. He has been in the electronics business for eight years. He started with 3 million shillings and now has 5 million shillings. His hardship is customers not paying on time, building a permanent house and expanding to new markets. Julius needs a loan to buy solar panels to sell.

loans.use: to buy solar panels to sell.

loans.name: Zephaniah

texts.en:
Zephaniah used his previous loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy transistors, speakers, motherboards and TY kits.  His business improved since he serviced the loan.  He has also improved the business with the business management skills that he has gained from the training conducted by Faulu Kenya.

Now, he has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy his own house.

loans.use: To buy a house.

loans.name: Roque Manuel

texts.es:
Roque  es una hombre casado de 46 años  y tiene dos hijos de 4 y 5 años de edad. el señor Roque trabaja en el servicio de transporte haciendo taxi en una moto alquilada, sus hijos cursan el nivel inicial.
Él es un buen trabajador, que se esfuerza todos los días por sacar adelante a su familia. 
Roque empezó su negocio en el año 2008 en el transporte. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y 7 días a la semana.. No ha tenido créditos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1300 que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Roque invertirá su crédito para la compra de su propia moto. También su crédito permitirá a Roque a pensar en el futuro y el sueña con tener su propia casa y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su asesor de crédito cree que es excelente cliente y puede pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Roque is a married man, aged 46. He has two children, aged 4 and 5. Roque provides transportation services as a taxi driver using a rented moto taxi. His children are in primary school.

He is a good worker who works every day to get his family ahead.

Roque started his transportation business in 2008. Every day he works about 12 hours, 7 days a week. He has not had loans before. Roque will use the loan of 1300 nuevos soles that he will receive thanks to Kiva to purchase his own moto taxi. The loan will also allow Roque to think about the future, and he dreams of having his own house and giving his family a better quality of life. His credit assessor believes he is an excellent client and can make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase his own moto taxi

loans.name: Aquiles Oswaldo

texts.es:
Aquiles Oswaldo tiene 25 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa  y con el hijo de 1 año de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC ALAS DE CRISTO  se encuentra ubicada en las calles sucre y Ernesto Briones, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Comerciales en General.

Aquiles  se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años , las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería, ropa para hombres y mujeres de toda edad.

Con la ayuda del préstamo obtendrá  beneficios económicos.
El sueño es comprarse un carro, no se le ha presentado ningún problema , en los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Aquiles Oswaldo is 25 years old and lives with his common-law wife and one-year-old son in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank ALAS DE CRISTO is located on Sucre and Ernesto Briones Streets in the Ventanas Canton.  In general, the members are merchants.

Aquiles is a farmer and also has been selling clothing for six years.  He buys and sells his goods in Ventanas and is requesting a loan to buy men's and women's clothing, for all ages.  With the help of the loan he will be able to make a good profit.  

His dream is to buy a car.  He has not run into any problemas and enjoys watching television in his free time.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a farmer and a businessman running a mobile phone and money transfer business in the local market besides farming.  He is married and has one child aged 1, with himself being 22 years old. He has been in farming for 5 years, growing maize as the main produce for the local market.

Shadrack has requested for a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  He says the income generated will assist him in building a strong foundation for his family.  He hopes to make farming his source of livelihood and help him raise capital for a wholesale milk processing business.

Shadrack laments the high production costs and poor infrastructure.  He however appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services.

loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 34-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 15 and 5.  Three of them go to school. 

Joyce runs a food store and has been in the business for 4 years. She has no employees. Joyce heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients, outreach, and promotion done by the loans officers. She is taking a loan of SDG 2000 to purchase more food items like onions, green pepper, Irish potatoes, and many others. Besides this business, Joyce has no other sources of income.

In 5 years time, Joyce hopes to increase her business and make it better.

Her major challenges include issues with home expenses and school fees. 

Joyce says that she is grateful for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like onions, green peppers, Irish potatoes, and many others

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El señor Claudio tiene 22 años de edad, está casado con la señora Cristina, tienen un hijo pequeño, el cual ellos mismos dicen, es la razón de la lucha de la pareja.
El señor Claudio es comerciante desde hace tiempo, tiene una Despensa bien surtida en su domicilio. Nos cuenta que tiene mucha clientela de la zona ya que comercializa todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y es una de las pocas despensas que hay en la zona. Su esposa lo ayuda siempre ya que el a menudo debe salir para buscar productos para poder abastecer el local. Gracias a la lucha de ambos han podido salir adelante y mantener a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de enlatados, carnes, lácteos, panificados y demás artículos de primera necesidad, lo cual tiene más salida. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad de progreso que les da.
texts.en:
Mr. Claudio is 22 years old, married to Cristina; they have a young son, which they say is why they struggle.
Mr. Claudio is a merchant for some time now, has a well-stocked pantry at home. He tells us that he has much business in the area and sells all kinds of staples and is one of the few pantries that are in the area. His wife always helps since often he must leave to search for products in order to supply the premises. Thanks to the struggle of both they have been able to move forward and support their family.
He is asking for a loan for the purchase of canned goods, meat, dairy, bread and other staples, which has more output. He is thankful to KIVA for the opportunity they give him.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, meat, dairy, bread and other staples.

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru: Абдукарим целеустремленный, добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и любящий отец двоих детей. Абдукарим работает в дехканском хозяйстве уже 4 года. С детства он работал с отцом на огороде и выращивал сельхозпродукции. В бизнесе помогает отец и супруга. Абдукарим хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль, чтобы построить жилищный дом. С этой целью запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и семян репчатого лука.
texts.en: Abdukarim is a goal-oriented, kind and hardworking man.  He is married and is a loving father of two children.  Abdukarim has been working at a dekhan farm for four years.  Since childhood, he worked with his father in the garden and grew agricultural crops.  His father and wife help him with the business.  Abdukarim wants to expand his business and make a good profit in order to build a residential house.  To achieve this goal, he is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and onion seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and onion seeds

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is 43 years old. She has two children whom are studying at school. She raises chickens and ducks for a living. She has done this job for 6 years and gained from it 4,200,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to raise ducks’ egg for selling. Then she will use the benefit for affording her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to raise ducks’ egg for selling. Then she will use the benefit for affording her children’s education fees.

loans.name: Oswaldo Mauricio

texts.es:
Oswaldo tiene 33 años vive en union libre en un casa arrenda tiene dos hijos vive en Ventanas.

Es miembro de la VRC. Las palmas esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agricolas como la siembra de maiz y arroz

oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz. El credito le ayudado para invertir el insumos como semillas fertilizantes y polvos para matar las bacterias que dañan los cultivos.


El sueño de Oswaldo es tener dinero para poder comprar un terreno y construir la casa. 


Le gusta hacer deporte con los amigos del barrio y jugar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Oswaldo, 33, lives in a common-law marriage and has two children. He lives with his wife and children, ages 15 and 8, in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos. He's a member of Las Palmas Communal Bank, located in Recinto Campo Alegre in Bab Canton, where they make a living farming.

Oswaldo has worked for 15 years in farming, growing corn and rice. He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas.

He's requesting the loan to plant corn and buy compost. With the help of the loan he'll be able to invest in agriculture and earn a profit.

His dream is to be able to have a house. He hasn't experienced any kind of problem. In his free time he likes to go out for walks.

loans.use: fertilizantes y polvos para matar las bacterias

loans.name: Murotjon

texts.en: Murotjon is 28 years old. He is hardworking man. He is married and has 2 children. His wife Zarrina has been busy with animal husbandry. Murotjon runs his business deal with growing onions more than 10 years. He has a land where he grows onion. His parents help him with growing onion. He runs business well. Murotjon is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy seeds and to pay for rental workers. From profit he is going to improve living condition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and to pay for rental workers

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey and his family arrived to Oaxaca, Mexico 7 years ago thanks to his brother who came there earlier. Rey is a 27 year-old employee of a grocery store. His 22 year-old wife, Lorena sells tamales in the community to get an extra income.  A tamal is a traditional Mexican dish made of corn masa, which is steamed in a leaf wrapper and can be filled with meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, chilies or any preparation according to taste.

Lorena is not happy to see her daughter Karen (6) suffering a lot in the rainy season. She gets scared when the wind or rain hits the house. Karen goes in the first year of the elementary school; she enjoys watch TV and play with her neighbors, her friends. 

The mail problems of Rey´s house are the insecurity, the lack of comfort and the overcrowding conditions.  The actual house is not a safe place to live in and they are afraid to lose the house due its fragility, the roof leaks a lot when it rains and they are tired of cover with plastic their belongings every time. Besides those problems, the house is small and its difficult to make diferent activities at the same time.
 
“…my life would change because I can leave my wife and my daughter at home knowing that is a safe house and they won’t have problems if it rains. We will have happy moments because we do not need to worry about the weather.  My dream is to offer my best to my daughter and a new house means her legacy” says Rey.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Abineza Group

texts.en:
ABINEZA is a group led by Marie who is 44 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 8 and 20 years.The group name means “THE FAVOURABLE PEOPLE” in English. She has been a group leader for 1 years. She sells charcoal and has been selling in a business for 2 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of her shop in order to meet customer demand and all family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a craftsman who works in leather. He buys cattle hides and tans them and then sells the finished leather to other craftsman for use in making leather jackets, shoes, and suitcases. In this way, he generates jobs for other leather artisans. He is studying Biochemistry at the Main State University of San Andrés, in the city of La Paz. He lives at home with his parents on 23rd of March Street in the city of El Alto. His shop is located in the same house. He is 29 years old. Juan Carlos works with his brothers, for whom he provides a source of work and the loan will be used to buy the raw material.

This is his first loan with IMPRO, and the evaluation he underwent was positive, which allows him to take out the loan that he has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Carlos es artesano y trabaja en cuero. Compra cuero de ganado vacuno para la transformación del mismo en materia prima y es de esta forma que comercializa su producto a otros artesanos para la elaboración de chamarras, calzados y maletines, con lo cual genera fuentes de trabajo para otros artesanos en cuero. Es estudiante de la Universidad Estatal Mayor de San Andrés de la ciudad de La Paz en la carrera de Bio-Química, Vive en la Casa de sus padres en la Calle 23 de Marzo de la Ciudad de El Alto, su taller se encuentra ubicado en el mismo domicilio y tiene 29 años. Juan Carlos trabaja con sus hermanos a quienes proporciona una fuente de trabajo y el crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima. Es el primer crédito en Impro, y la evaluación que se ha efectuado es positiva, lo cual le permite acceder al crédito que solicita.

loans.use: Working capital to buy cow hides for tanning

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Business Description

When she was young, Carmen began selling food with her mother. She enjoys the business because this was her dream. Little by little, with her savings she decided to buy a cart and begin working on her own. Her mother helped her a lot in the beginning. She could fit on the side of her home a spot for her cart. She worked only on weekends from 4 p.m. until 11 p.m. On the other days, she worked as a guard for a business looking after a health center.

Loan Use

Her desire is to be able to buy food products so that she may offer better service to her clients. Also, she is going to change some reeds on her restaurant walls that are damaged.

Personal Information

Carmen is a single mother. She is 29 years old and has a son who is 13 years old. She only wants to be able to give her son an education. Her mother is the person that helps her in the preparation of the food. Her desire is to be able to begin constructing a little cement home and give a better life to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Carmen desde joven junto a su mama se inicio con la venta de comida. Le gusto ya que esa era su sueño. Poco a poco con sus ahorros decide comprarse una carreta y comienza a trabajar sola. Su mama la ayudo bastante en su inicio. Pudo adecuar al lado de su domicilio un local para poder tener su carreta. Trabaja solo los fines de semana en horario de 4 p.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Además los otros días trabaja de guardia para una empresa cuidando un centro de salud.

Uso del Préstamo

Su deseo es poder tener comprado ya sus productos con el que ella le brindaría un mejor servicio a sus clientes. También va ha cambiar algunas cañas de su local que están dañadas.

Información Personal

Carmen es madre soltera. Tiene 29 años y un hijo de 13. Ella sola a podido darle la educación a su hijo. Su mama es la persona que le ayuda en la preparación de la comida. Su deseo es poder comenzar a construir su casita de cemento y darle una mejor vida a su hijo.

loans.use: Improve restaurant site and buy food to cook.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Nov L., 38, is married with 2 children, both of whom are students. Her husband (pictured here) works as a tuk-tuk driver. Mrs. Nov L. earns $21 a day as a street vendor and is taking out this loan so that she can more easily transport her products. Any money that is left over after this purchase will be used to repair her house. In the future she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her products, and to repair her house.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan M. is a 33-year-old man who keeps and raises livestock and fodder in the small village near the Saatli region which is  situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Ruslan is married and has two sons. He started his business in 2007. Although he does not have  experience he works very hard. Ruslan started raising fodder for cattle and sells it to the local farmers. With the money he received for the fodder he purchased a calf and he is going to engage in the meat production business. For this purpose he has applied for 900 USD. This amount will help him to purchase three calves, raise them and sell them for meat to the local bazaar traders. The estimated cost for calf is 200-300 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase 3 calves

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Mrs. Khat Y., 62, is married with five children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She stays at home cooking food for her members, while her husband is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver, earning around $1/day of profit. Moreover, two of her children are blacksmiths, another one is a driver, and the rest of whom are unemployed. Mrs. Khat Y. hopes to use this loan to purchase cows to breed and the leftover of the money is to purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a business as a motor-taxi driver.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a business as a motor-taxi driver

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Mrs. Margarita Centurión lives in San Ignacio Misiones, she lives in a house with her mother and younger sister. The family raises and sells chickens, and has been in this business for 5 years.

She raises the chickens on her house’s patio and sells them by taking them via motorcycle from her home to the city as well as other cities such as Santa Maria, Santa Rosa y San Patricio (cities that are only a few minutes from San Ignacio).

With the income from this activity she is able to support her family and also cover the health expenses of her daughter, who suffers from epilepsy and the treatment is very expensive.

The loan is to purchase chickens in order to meet the high demand that occurs at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Margarita Centurión, reside en la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones; habita en la casa de su madre junto con otra hermana menor, la familia se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de pollos parrilleros con una antigüedad de 5 años en el negocio.

La cría de los mismos lo realiza en el patio de su casa y la venta la realiza recorriendo en una moto de su propiedad y por diferentes ciudades como Santa Maria, Santa Rosa y San Patricio (ciudades que quedan a pocos minutos de San Iganacio).

Con los ingresos percibidos con esta actividad mantiene a su familia y también cubre los gastos de salud de su hija, quien padece de principio de epilepsia y el tratamiento que esta siguiendo es costoso.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar pollos parrilleros para poder abastecer su gran demanda de fin de año.

loans.use: Purchase chickens

loans.name: Golondrinas Group

texts.es:
Various endeavors, from making and selling food to sales of general merchandise, have brought together twelve women, most of whom are married with children, to form the association, Las Golondrinas ("The Swallows"), named for birds that in the winter travel long distances to find food for their chicks.

In the same way, these women travel long distances day in and day out to sell their products in the public markets of their town so that they can return home at the end of the day with enough money to keep their families going and provide for their children.

The traditional Alasitas market fair (a miniature and crafts fair) in La Paz, one of the most important of the year, is coming up so the association's members need funds to rent space and get their products ready so that they can generate sales and increase their incomes. That's especially important for the mothers in the group because, with the school year about to start, they'll see a big jump in their expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Actividades distintas, como la preparación y venta de comida, y principalmente el comercio de todo tipo de mercadería ha reunido a un grupo de doce mujeres en su mayoría casadas y con hijos, que identificaron a su asociación como Las Golondrinas, aves que en invierno recorren largas distancias hasta lograr llegar a sus nidos con el alimento necesario para sus crías.

De igual forma estas mujeres recorren grandes distancias durante el día para lograr la venta de sus productos, en ferias, plazas, mercados de su zona para que al final del día puedan retornar a sus hogares con el dinero suficiente para sobrevivir día tras día y satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos.

Próximamente, en la ciudad de La Paz se realizará la tradicional feria de Alasitas, (feria de la miniatura y artesanía), una de las más importantes del año, motivo por el cual las socias precisan de capital, con el fin de introducir su mercadería, alquilar algunos puestos, y poder generar la venta necesaria para incrementar sus ingresos, en vista de que se aproxima la temporada de inicio de clases, lo que representa un fuerte gasto para aquellas que son madres de familia.

loans.use: The traditional Alasitas market fair (a miniature and crafts fair) in La Paz, one of the most important of the year, is coming up so the association's members need funds to rent space and get their products ready so that they can generate sales and increase their incomes.  That's especially important for the mothers in the group because, with the school year about to start, they'll see a big jump in their expenses.

loans.name: Koser's Group

texts.en:
I am Koser B., married and a mother of six: three girls and three boys. I live with my family in Faisalabad, Pakistan. My husband trades used items. He is in this business since his teens. My husband wants to expand his business but lacks the needed financing. I hope to save extra profits from his income for my children. I request this loan for my other loan group members as well. Zarka B. and Sajida B. both will invest their shares of the loan in their husband’s meat shop. Tasneem B. wants a loan for the repair of her husband’s truck. Suriya N. requires this loan for her son, who wants to start a furniture manufacturing business. All of these women know each other for a long time and help each other in times of need.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Expand used items business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mr. Kim D., 66, lives with his wife Lim Heang and their 6 children in Bak Rotes Village, Pursat Province. He earns $10 per day as a house construction foreman. D. also has a side business raising fish. His children have finished studying and help him raise fish. D. requests a $1,000 loan to purchase a motorcycle and more fish for his business. With a motorcycle, D. will be able to transport and sell fish more efficiently at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and more fish for his business

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem O. is 43 years old. Her husband’s name is Sam Kreng (pictured here in their home as Yem O. was unavailable to be photographed). He is 42 years old. The two of them run a business in the remote province of Prey Veng, renting out music equipment like stereos, microphones, soundboards, and other such devices. Their combined income through this business is 3.20 US$ per day. They have five children, with four still unmarried and living in the family home. Three of their children are construction workers, each earning 150 US$ per month. This significantly adds to the family income and is important because the parent’s business is mostly seasonal.

Between the months of January and May is the harvest season as well as when several other key Khmer holidays occur. In preparation for this high time of parties and karaoke, a beloved Khmer pastime, Yem O. would like to invest in newer equipment to expand her inventory and hopefully draw in more business this year.

loans.use: To buy speakers and stereo equipment.

loans.name: Marcelina's Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring Women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women the energy and motivation to reach success.

In a remote area of Carapegua called Quiindy, a group of women heard about The Committee of Entrepreneuring Women. They set up a meeting and shared their desire of changing their world for the better by working very hard. These hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a Committee.

Among the businesses these women run are grocery stores and sales of chipas and crafts. Some of these women are weavers. They need the credit to buy the materials related to their businesses; for instance, threads, fabrics, crafts, and ingredients to prepare chipas and others.

loans.use: Purchase of threads, fabrics, crafts, ingredients to prepare chipas and others.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor is 38 years old, married, and has three children, who are 2, 9, and 14 years old. Her husband is a taxi driver and they live in the 3-80 neighbourhood of the city. They bought the taxi from their own savings and are responsible for its maintenance. Also, for the last twelve years, Flor has been selling handicrafts.

With this loan, they plan to buy building materials to build a new room in their house. In time, they also hope to trade in their taxi for a newer model to enable them to give their customers a better service.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Flor habita en el barrio 3-80, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 2, 9 y 14 años de edad, su esposo es taxista y el vehículo que usa lo compraron ambos con esfuerzo propio y es él quien se encarga de administrarlo. Doña Flor vende artesanía desde hace doce años y este negocio también lo iniciaron por cuenta propia. Con el préstamo quieren comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un nueva habitación. En un futuro esperan poder cambiar la unidad de taxi por una más nueva, para así poder dar mejor servicio de taxi.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials to construct a new room

loans.name: Aisha's Bidii Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 26 years old. She is a single woman with 3 children, ages 13, 10, and 1. She became a food seller in 2007. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Aisha now hopes for a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing with vegetable sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en: Kwadwo is a 28-year-old man. He is married with three children who are currently in school. He is an agrochemical seller and sells herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers. Many local farmers patronize his business because it is now the season during which most farmers are actively planting their crops. He wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies to serve the needs of his customers. He hopes to earn enough money to sponsor his kids' education.  Kwadwo is a member of a group called 'Nyame do' Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines

loans.name: Mohammad Halam

texts.en:
M. Halam is 19 years old. He is single and he just finished school. He has a retail shop where he works with one of his older brothers. He likes a lot working in the retail shop. Therefore, when he was trying to enlarge this business, he found AFSG in Kabul.

He requested an individual loan to buy more inventory for his shop and change his business by expanding it. He would like to be a good shopkeeper in the future to make bright future.

He is happy. After one or two years, he wants to open anther shop for his big brother. He wants to be a good client for Kiva and AFSG and would love to continue his partnership. He would like to thank lenders.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for his shop

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Marié pere de famille,cheikh s 'active dans la vente des pieces de rehange pour vehicule depuis années .Les principaux produits qu' il vende sont des huilles moteur ,les joints,liquide pour frein,et autres accessoires pour vehicule.Avec le pret il va renforcer son activité en achettant des quantites importante de marchandises.
texts.en:
Cheikh is married and the father of a family. He has been active in selling spare parts for vehicles for years. The principal products he sells are motor oil, gaskets, brake fluid, and other vehicular accessories. With this loan, he is going to bolster his business by buying sizable amounts of goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kuzi

texts.en: R. Kuzi is 44 years old and married. He and his wife of 12 years have five beautiful children. In addition to going to school, the two older children help Kuzi with his daily work, which consists of growing crops such as onions, potatoes and wheat. He has been in this line of work for 12 years, and has been helped for that entire time by his wife. Now, he has applied for a loan of $600 to buy seeds and fertilizer, which will allow the family to increase its output. He promises to repay the loan in 12 months, and thanks Kiva for the support it provides to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina lives in a community where the people work together to better their livelihoods and develop their village.

She is 56 years old and already a widow. She is responsible for raising her five children by herself. Her eldest is Bernard, 33 years old, married and has finished a vocational course. Next is Marrieta, who is 28 years old, married, and a college undergraduate working abroad to support her own family. Basilio, is 25 years old, also a vocational course graduate and now serving in the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP). Saturnino is 21 years old, and a high school graduate. The youngest is Dominic, 15 years old and an elementary school graduate.

She supported her five children through her farm. Saturnina is thankful to God that she was able to raise her children to grow up with good attitudes, even though she didn't have enough money to provide them with a high level of education.

Currently, Saturnina hopes to create better opportunities in her farming and hog raising business. She is therefore requesting a loan of PHP 20,000.00 so she can buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds. She will also use the loan to purchase feed supplies for her hogs.

She is glad that they have their own hand tractor because it makes farm cultivation easy. The family also owns a tricycle, which serves as another source of income.

Saturnina believes that praying to God is the best way to become successful in life.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Alberto Cayetano

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Alberto Cayetano se dedica a su negocio de venta de queso el cual es comercializado en el mercado municipal donde es visitado por sus clientes que le compran el queso en su establecimiento.

El señor Cayetano tiene la responsabilidad de mantener su familia y su humilde hogar de habitación y es esta la razón por la cual se esfuerza grandemente en el negocio de la venta del queso. Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra del queso  para continuar comercializándolo en el mercado municipal de Somotillo y de esta forma mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Alberto Cayetano sells cheese from his store in the municipal market where his customers come to buy his cheese. Mr. Cayetano is responsible for taking care of his humble home and for this reason, as he is running out of cheese to sell, he is asking for Ceprodel's help with a loan to buy more cheese for resale in the market of Somotillo and thus keep his business open.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.en:
Djumagul P. is 43 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Djumagul sells office supplies and school supplies. Her shop, located near a school in her village, has a wide range of goods; the majority of her customers are schoolchildren. In comparison with other big stores selling office supplies, Djumagul’s prices are lower and more attractive. Now she is requesting 400 USD for a term of 12 months to purchase office supplies for re-sale.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica D. sells fabric and sewing materials at Abura. Veronica has received senior high education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Veronica has been selling fabric and sewing materials for about 8 years. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family's other financial needs. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of fabric and sewing materials to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of  her little sewing notions business.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of fabric, etc.

loans.name: Thi Kim Dung

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Kim Dung  năm nay 24  tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ tại huyện Kim Động tỉnh Hưng Yên. Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương từ đầu năm 2008. Hiện tại chị ở nhà chăn nuôi lợn còn chồng chị làm nghề lái xe thuê. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình chị  là 2.000.000.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Kim Dung, 24 years old, lives with her husband and child at Kim Dong village, Hung Yen town. She has joined the TYM Fund since the beginning of 2008. Currently, she rears pigs at home while her husband works as a driver. Her family's monthly income is 2 millions VND. This time, she would like to borrow 9 millions VND to purchase more pigs and animal feeds.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing pigs

loans.name: Assétou

texts.fr:
Madame  Assétou D.   est âgée de 41 ans,  veuve et mère de  8  enfants, elle vit chez son feu époux  avec ses  enfants au quartier Pelengana village  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école, elle a commencé le commerce auprès de son frère qui vendait de l’oignon, de l’ail et du gueni (racines parfumées se trouvant dans des zones humides utilisées dans la préparation de l’encens) pendant 15ans et finit par évoluer seule après avoir acquis suffisamment d’expériences. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation et d’une grande clientèle.
Madame Assétou D. a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour renforcer son fonds de commerce. En relation avec cette dernière depuis 28 mois, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel  après avoir bien remboursé 3 prêts solidaires. 
Ce nouveau prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter 300 kg de riz, 300 kg de (gueni).Elle s’approvisionne à Dougabougou et Siribala. Elle vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle constituée  d’hommes et de femmes sur place à Ségou et à Bamako où elle a beaucoup de clients.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA.qui lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (car elle est veuve) et payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants qui sont à bas âge. 
Elle ambitionne  pérenniser son commerce de riz et de (gueni).
texts.en:
Mrs. Assétou D., 41, is a widowed mother of 8 children; she lives in the house of her late husband with her children in the Pelengana neighborhood of the village of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She never attended school, so she began working in sales with her brother, who sold onions, garlic, and "gueni" (good smelling roots that grow in humid areas and are used in making incense). She worked with him for 15 years and finally began selling on her own account, when she had gained enough experience. She has an excellent reputation and an extensive clientele.

Mrs. Assétou D. turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to reinforce her working capital. She has been a member for 28 months and is now on her third individual loan, after having reimbursed 3 solidarity loans correctly. This new loan will be used to buy 300 kg of rice and 300 kg of "gueni". She does her buying in Dougabougou and Siribala. She sells for cash and credit to a clientele constituted of men and women right there in Ségou and in Bamako where she has a lot of customers.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA which will permit her to support her family (since she is a widow) and pay the school fees for her younger children. She hopes to be able to keep up her sales of rice and "gueni".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and "gueni" (sweet-smelling roots)

loans.name: Olusola

texts.en: Olusola is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs and kerosene. She is requesting the loan amount of 60,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Kossi Mawuli

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un résident du quartier de bè-klikamè  qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, il est célibataire et pour pouvoir subvenir convenablement à ses besoins il a commencé l’année dernière le commerce de friperie. Ce commerce marche bien pour lui car beaucoup de jeunes aiment acheter  leurs vêtements dans la friperie car ses vêtements sont en plus d’être de bonnes qualités moins chers. Il s’approvisionne au marché local de hedzranawoè, il souhaite agrandir son commerce et sollicite pour cela son premier crédit pour acheter 2 ballots de friperie.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a resident of the Bè-Klikamè district, which is an outlying ara of the city of Lomé. He is unmarried, and to meet his needs properly, he began selling second-hand clothes last year. This business works well for him, because lots of young people like buying their clothes in his store, since his clothes, besides being of good quality, are cheaper. He supplies himself at the local market in Hedzranawoè. He hopes to enlarge his business and for this, he is seeking his first loan to buy 2 bundles of used clothing.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 45 years old and married with three children. Her children are currently in school. To help her husband support the family, she sells cosmetics in the local community. She has many loyal clients. She says that selling cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory. She believes that this will enable her to make a better income to meet her family’s needs.

Alice is a member of the group called “Odo ye de,” which means "Love is sweet." Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es: Marta Lilian S. de 44 años de edad reside en Lourdes Colón, junto a sus dos hijos mayores de edad los cuales se dedican a trabajar y contribuyen junto a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Marta posee un taller de costura, en el cual se dedica a confeccionar ropa para niños y adultos de todas las edades, ella posee ya 16 años de tener su negocio, es por esto que solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda mejorarlo y poder seguir trabajando en el, ya que necesita comprar más tela, hilos, maquina nueva de coser entre otras cosas muy importantes para realizar su trabajo. Marta posee muy buenas referencias ya que todas las personas de su colonia la reconocen como una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se ha esforzado por darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta Lilian S. is 44 years of age and lives in the Lourdes district with her two adult children. They both work and contribute with their mother towards the household expenses. Marta has a seamstress shop where she works at making clothing for children and adults of all ages. She's been in this business for 16 years now. She is seeking a loan for this business so that she can improve it and be able to continue working there. She needs to buy more fabric, thread, and a new sewing machine among other things which are very important to her work. Marta has very good references since all of the people in her district know her as a very hardworking woman who strives to provide the best for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: La señora Ana atienD. su tienda D. barrio ubicada en la zona D. Pampahasi, tiene diversos productos para atraer mas clientela, tiene un solo  hijo D. 9 años D. edad que está en edad escolar, y ella sola se dedica a su manutención, vive humildemente en la trastienda (parte trasera del negocio)en cuarto pequeño solo para los dos. Es una cliente puntual y no trabaja con otra institución. El crédito será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, fideo y harina por quintales.
texts.en:
Ana has a neighborhood store, which is located in the Pampashasi zone. She carries diverse products to attract more customers. She has one child, a nine year old son who is of school age. She raises and supports him by herself. They live very humbly in a small room in the back of the store. She is a punctual client, and she does not work with another institution. The loan is to buy groceries like rice, sugar, noodles, and quintales (one quintal is 46 kg.) of flour.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries (rice, oil, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Moshi

texts.en:
Moshi is a member of the Mwangata C borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is a 38-year-old woman, married, and has 5 children. Her children are ages 18, 16, 13, 5, and 3 years.

Moshi started her own business selling CDs 2 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Moshi’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 Tsh in order to to buy more CDs. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Moshi hopes to save money, repair her house, get more food for her family, and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more CDs to sell

loans.name: Domenciana

texts.en:
Domenciana M. is a member of the Rizal South Branch in Talim Island of ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She is married and is the mother to two: a boy and a girl. Both of her children are still dependent on her to survive. Her husband, Francisco, is 37 years old and is a fisherman. they lives in the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines.

With her dream to lift up her family from poverty, Domenciana joined ASHI in 2008 with hopes to have access to capital for her business. During her early loans, she invested them all in purchasing fishing nets and other fishing gear. She was been running her fishing business for almost fifteen years and it brings her a good income for the sustainability of the needs of her family.

Now on her third loan, Domenciana requests 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. The loan will be used to pay for twenty bundles of assorted types of fishing nets, ropes, and other materials for fishing. She is hopeful that, with the trust and support from ASHI and Kiva, she can reach her dream little by little, send her children to school up to college level and repair her house to make it spacious and more durable.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, ropes, and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
K. Guldasta is a hard worker and a person who takes charge. She is married and has three children. Her husband receives a very low wage and he could not handle all the expenses of his family. For this reason, Guldasta found it necessary to start a family business. Guldasta began to sell foodstuffs in her grocery store. This was the start of the business, and together they have managed to advance it. Guldasta is now requesting a loan of 3500 somoni to expand her business to be able to offer a better service to her clients, and to improve the store. Guldasta thanks you for the confidence and aid that you offer her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for a grocery

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita E. is a 51-year-old mother of four children, one of whom is still in school.  Nenita is married to Julio, a carpenter.

Nenita works hard to pay for their basic daily needs, so she decided to open a general store three years ago with a handful of items to sell and a few thousand pesos to invest. Her general store gradually grew bigger. and Nenita now earns 27, 000.00 a month from her store.

Nenita joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006.  She has invited other women in her community to her group. She has just finished repaying her previous loan with the cooperative.  She is now on her 10th loan. She has applied for a new loan of P12, 000.00. She dreams of having a larger grocery store some day.  

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Mezyl

texts.en: Mezyl G. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Mezyl owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mezyl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mezyl is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en: Ferdinand is a hard-working farmer from Agusan Del Sur. He is 33 years old and still single. His rice crop is starting to grow but still needs inputs like fertilizer to continue growing. Ferdinand is a new member of CEVI and in his opinion, CEVI’s program is very helpful to him and his fellow farmers. Add to that, the benefits they can receive through the insurance service. For his first loan, he requested PHP 6,000. He will use this loan to acquire the farm inputs he needs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna E., who is 46 years old, is a rice farmer. She started helping her husband till a 1-½ hectare farm to raise money for all the family's needs.  She has only one child. Erna is doing the best she can to be a good mother and a good wife. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. Erna will use the loan to buy farming necessities for their farm. With this loan, she doesn’t need to apply for a loan from loan sharks, who charge high interest rates.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Onh

texts.en:
Mrs. Onh D. lives in Ream Andoeuk village in Takeo province. She sells rice and soup. Her husband, Mr. Yaem Muoy, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family.

Mr. Yaem Muoy wants to start his own business charging batteries. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Onh D. decided to request a loan to buy the equipment he needs, and she would use the rest of the money to buy more supplies for her own business.

She is 51 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a soup seller and the other is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy equipment for charging batteries.

loans.name: Sabari Group

texts.en:
Fanta K. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Sabari. She is married with 4 children between 25 and 32 years old; their educational levels range from 7th to 9th grade. Due to poverty, Fanta herself is illiterate. She also cares for 2 daughters in law.

Fanta lives around the Gbarnga Central market but works in the market in Gbarnga, Liberia. She sells general goods. She buys them wholesale; then she sells them retail in the Gbarnga Central Market. Fanta has been operating this business for four years, and hopes to improve the shop in the future. She always gives customers discounts in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Fanta needs this loan to purchase additional goods that will improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and building a house for them.

loans.use: purchasing additional goods to improve business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 45, sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for five years. Her husband works with a security company, and through her business, Mary has been able to supplement her husband's income in order to meet the basic needs of her family. She is proud of the fact that her six children are excelling in school.

Mary is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She hopes to increase and improve on her sales during this festive season. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000, which she wishes to use to purchase grocery items to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
33-year-old Arnold is the father of two children. He is married and his oldest child is only 1-year-old. Arnold is a rice farmer. He is happy to say that his business is going well, and he was able to save a small amount of money from the last harvest. He wants to continue saving so he can give his children a proper education.

Arnold is a member of the Kiva field partner, CEVI. He is now requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which he will use to finance his farm. With this loan, he will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farming necessities. This loan will also help Arnold earn more.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. is 20 years old. She is in the business of selling fish in Kilifi, in a place called Charo Wamae. She has been selling fish for two years to the locals of Charo Wamae and the demand for her fish has been strong.

Margaret joined KADET recently after being introduced by a fellow group member and is glad to now have access to capital in order to help boost her fish business. With the loan, she plans to buy more fish stock and to buy two fish boxes for display.

Margaret hopes to one day build a permanent structure where she can comfortably operate her business.

loans.use: To buy fish stock and two boxes for fish display

loans.name: Merle Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Señora Merle Auxiliadora tiene 26 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería hace mas de 3 años, que se dedica a este negocio es madre de 2 niños que dependen de ella, por lo que se esmera mucho por proporcionarle lo necesario a su familia.  En la actualidad ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes ya que diariamente se levanta muy temprano para comprar visitar al mercado y comprar los productos necesarios para su negocio. Este es el motivo del financiamiento para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas, jugos, gaseosas entre otros productos. Su deseo es seguir creciendo con su negocio, que es su medio de vida.
texts.en:
Merle Auxiliadora, 26, has had a small grocery store for the past 3 years. She has two, dependent children; they are the reason she works so hard to provide for her family's needs. Currently, she has a lot of experience in this line of work. She is well-known and well-liked among her customers. She rises very early every morning to go to market to buy the goods she will need for her store. This is the reason for her loan request: to buy sweets, beverages, bread, cookies, juices, soft-drinks, among others. Her wish is to continue to have her business, which is her means of support, grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Raymunda P. is a married woman who supports her family through her dressmaking and tailoring business. She lives in Bongalanon, Basay, Negros Oriental with her husband Jose. He is 58 years old and works as a fisherman. They have eight children, some of whom are working and some are currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her dressmaking/tailoring business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $68.

Raymunda is now borrowing 10,000 PHP so that she can buy additional clothes and materials for tailoring. This will be her 7th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 8,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Raymunda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional clothes and materials for tailoring

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Antonia es casada, tiene 58 años y 7 hijos, Antonia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, además Antonia tiene un taller de confeccione de prendas.
Antonia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fideo, arroz, leche, azúcar.
El sueño de Antonia es ir de vacaciones a otro país.
texts.en:
Antonia ia a member of group Lirio. She is married, 58 years old and has 7 children. Antonia has a general store where she sells household goods, meats and vegetables. As well, she has a shop where she makes clothes. Antonio needs a loan of 300 soles that will be invested in rice, beans, milk and sugar. Antonio`s dream is to go on vacation to another country.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of beans, rice, milk and sugar

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen N. W. is 27 years old, married with two children, ages four and two months.  One child attends school.  For two years Stephen has been running a retail shop where he sells mobile phone accessories, DVDs and movies. His business is located in Kawangware 46, a few kilometers away from Nairobi, the  capital city.  Stephen has previously taken out a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya which he used to expand his business.   He has requested for a loan of kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more movies, DVDs and mobile phone accessories for sale. He hopes to stabilize his income and improve his living standard in the future.

loans.use: To buy more movies, DVDs and mobile accessories

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en: Mrs. Chhom Y., 43, is a single mother living in Battambang Province. She earns a living raising pigs both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she cultivates a rice crop. Chhom Y. has four children — two of them single, one a vegetable seller and the other a construction worker. To make extra income and sustain her pig business, Chhom Y. will use her loan to buy more pig food and piglets to raise. She will also buy supplies for her rice farming.

loans.use: To purchase more pig food and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Maria Eloisa

texts.en:
Maria Eloisa L. is from the village of Guba in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Maria Eloisa is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Maria Eloisa owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products, such as canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, soap, and sugar, in the local community. Maria Eloisa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria Eloisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Eloisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria Eloisa is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.
