This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Maria Eloisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start up business

loans.name: Gounadon

texts.fr: GOUNADON L. L. est née le 19 Octobre 1964 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. L. L. est mariée à DASSI Damien, un comptable. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a près de treize ans que L. L. vit au quartier Suru-Léré à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. L. L. vit en effet dans ce quartier ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage ensemble les différentes charges familiales. L. L. a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, puis a appris la couture, une activité qu'elle exerce depuis vingt ans et qu'elle continue d'exercer. Parallèlement, L. L. vend des oeufs, du sucre en poudre et de l'eau "Pur Water" à son domicile. L. L. achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. La clientèle de L. L. augmente au jour le jour et L. L. n'arrive plus à tous les satisfaire compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose. C'est donc pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que L. L. sollicite un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
L. L. GOUNADON was born on 19th October 1964 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Damien DASSI, an accountant. The couple has four children who are all at school. For almost 13 years L. L. has been living in the Suru-Léré district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Indeed, she lives in this district together with her children and husband. The couple share the different household expenses between them. L. L. left school during secondary school and then learned how to sew. She has been carrying out this activity for the past twenty years and continues to do so. At the same time, she sells eggs, caster sugar and "Pur Water" water from home. She buys her products at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She is an old client of ALIDé, having already had three loans which have all been repaid on time. L. L.'s customer base is growing all the time and she cannot satisfy all the demand, since her financial means are meagre. She is requesting a fourth loan in order to increase her working capital and to be able to satisfy customer demand more readily.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy trays of eggs, caster sugar and sachets of water

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom C. is 43 years old and lives in Roluos village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. For this farm, Mrs. Sokhom C. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to add to the old one for farming her crop. Aside from farming, she is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Chea Mom, is a sugar palm seller who earns a small income to support the family. This couple has a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Sok Ngann's Group

texts.en: Four people make up a loan group located in Ou Rumchek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sok Ngann H. is a group leader, selected by the other members who will each use their loans for different purposes. She was born in 1960. She and her husband, Mr. Bouna Hoem, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Now they have a problem because their field is far away from the irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Sok Ngann H. is applying for a loan to by a pump machine and hose. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are laborers in Malaysia, while the other one is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To by a water pump and hose

loans.name: Nuride

texts.en: Nuride M. is a 43 year old trader who sells different kinds of food in order to support herself financially. She started her business in 2009 and, since that time, has been doing very well. Her monthly income is about 400-500 AZN because her shop is in a very good location and a lot of people pass along during a day. Nuride has applied for 700 AZN in order to purchase more merchandise and to increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Yessenia Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Yessenia Carolina B. H. tiene la corta de edad de 22 años vive en el Reparto Rigoberto Lopez Pérez, es casada y su joven esposo es vendedor de frutas y verdura  brindando un ingreso fijo a la economía de la familia. Ellos tienen una niña de 7 años, que le dificulta el dejarla sola en la casa para ir a vender por tal razón es el papa quien realiza esta labor.

Pero esperan mejorar su economía y contratar el apoyo de una  domestica que le apoye a vigilar la casa y velar por su hija, esto se lograra gracias a la mejoría continua de la economía del hogar y para esto solicitan un préstamo para la compra de mayor inventario de abarrotes que aumenten el volumen de ventas y a largo plazo permitan llevar a cabo los planes de la familia.
texts.en:
Yessenia Carolina B. H. is 22 years old. This young woman lives in Reparto Rigoberto Lopez Pérez. She is married, and her young husband is a fruit and vegetable seller, bringing in a stable income to support the family. They have a daughter who is seven years old, which makes it difficult to leave her alone in the house to go out and sell, and for this reason it is the father who does this work. But they hope to improve their economic situation and hire a domestic worker to help them watch the house and watch over their daughter. They will achieve this thanks to the continual improvement of their home's economic situation, and for this they are requesting a loan to buy a larger inventory of groceries that will increase their sales volume and will in the long term permit them to carry out their plans for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of groceries to permit increased sales

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy D. is a 34-year-old mother of two children and a wife to Mr. Naftal. Her family lives in Jomvu, Mombasa, the place where she also gets to conduct her business.

Nancy sells clothes as a way of earning her living and has been operating her business for two years now. She wishes to expand her business even further and use the anticipated profit to help educate her children. As a result of this, she has found it necessary to borrow money from KADET for the second time.

As Nancy tries to expand her business, she hopes that in future she will be able to own her own boutique and no longer have to hawk (sell door-to-door).

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene 32 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene una excelente experiencia. Pues siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos con sus tres hijos.  Por lo que su actividad económica le ha brindado lo necesario y necesita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como ropa interior, cosméticos, perfumes, colonias. Ella sueña  en el futuro tener una actividad más sólida con mejores ingresos, lo cual para ella seria en establecer una tienda en su lugar de habitación, pues quiere ganarse la vida de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old. Her economic activity is selling general merchandise, and she has excellent experience in this field. She has three children and is always looking for ways to improve her income. Her work has provided her with the necessities, and she needs this loan to buy merchandise to sell, such as underwear, cosmetics, perfumes and colognes. She dreams of having a more solid enterprise in the future, providing a better income. For her, this would mean establishing a store in the place where she lives, since she would like to earn a living in the best way she can.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sirly Johana

texts.es:
Sirly de 24 años, vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas. ElL. vende productos de uso personal por una revista de ropa llamadas Esika. 

Comenzó a trabajar por L. falta de oportunidades ya que no esta casada pero tiene hijo de dos años, inicio con el código de una de sus amigas en esta revistas, cuando realmente tubo L. oportunidad de ingresar como vendedora invirtió dinero y compro ropa para venderL. a sus amigos y conocidos. Ahora elL. no tiene horario fijo por lo que trabaja a toda hora. 

Para seguir con las ventas elL. quiere compra con el préstamo ropa y productos de uso personal como perfumes y cremas. En el futuro quiere ser una líder de ventas y poder comprar un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sirly, 24, lives in an urban zone called “Las Orquídeas” so called because when it was first discovered there were many orchids there. She sells Esika brand personal use items via a clothing catalogue. She started to work because employment opportunities were few. She isn’t married but has a two-year-old son. She started working using a friend of hers i.d. number with one of these catalogues. When she got the opportunity to enroll as a seller herself, she invested money and bought clothes to sell to her acquaintances and friends. Now she doesn’t have a fixed work schedule because she works at all hours. To continue with her sales she needs a loan to buy clothing and personal use items like perfumes and creams. In the future she’d like to be a sales leader and be able to buy a vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing, perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Milagros Del Rosario

texts.es:
Milagros es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su eposo y a sus hijos en el sector Pueblo Nuevo del distrito de Buenos Aires, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente cacao y banano orgánico, pertenece a la provincia de Morropón y se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Hace dos años instaló en su vivienda un negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet, el servicio es usado por los jóvenes y escolares de la zona, los cuales lo utilizan principalmente para resolver sus tareas escolares y encontrar entretenimiento. Durante este tiempo su negocio se ha estado haciendo conocido y ya cuenta con clientes fijos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad lo utiliza apoyando a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economia de su familia.

Milagros desea brindar mantenimiento a sus computadoras para que estas puedan seguir operativas y su servicio siga teniendo buena calidad, para poder realizar su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar porprimera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Milagros es una mujer bastante activa y entregada a su familia, ella desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia. Los vecinos del lugar le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Milagros is a 30-year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Pueblo Nuevo sector of the district of Buenos Aires.  This is an agricultural zone, which primarily produces cacao and organic bananas.  It is in the Morropón district of the Piura region of the country, which is more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Two years ago, she installed an Internet café business in her home.  Her business is utilized by area youngsters and students primarily to do their homework and for entertainment.  Over this period of time, her business has become known and she now has regular customers.  She uses the income she generates through this activity to help her husband support the family financially.

Milagros wishes to maintain her computers so they continue to operate properly and she can provide a high level of service.  To meet her goal, she requested a loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Milagros is a very active woman, who is dedicated to her family.  She wants to continue to work to help them get ahead.  Her neighbors consider her a calm and responsible woman.

loans.use: To maintain her computers so she can improve her Internet cafe service.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Producción San Roque de Caaguazú  esta integrada por 20 señoras, tiene 2 años de funcionamiento como comité poseen una huerta ecologica de donde se proveen de verduras para el consumo de cada familia, aparte cada una tiene un trabajo diario.
Las mismas tuvieron conocimiento del Programa de Comité de Mujeres através de las promociones realizadas por la zona, las mismas necesitaban de un pequeño capital para invertir en sus labores y asi obtener mejor calidad de vida. 
Son personas humildes, muy unidas y desean un futuro mejor para todas, y tienen certeza que lo van a lograr gracias al apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Nemesia quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en ferias que el comite realiza en las semanas.
Por ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos que ella desea utilizar en la huerta para las verduras que van a cultivar.
texts.en:
The San Roque de Caaguazú Communal Bank is comprised of 20 women, and they have been together for two years.  As a group they have an ecological garden that provides vegetables for the consumption of each family.  Each member also has their daily work.  The members found out about the Programa de Comité de Mujeres through the promotional activities in the area.  

The members need a small amount of capital to invest in their work in order to have a better quality of life.  They are humble people.  They are very united, and they wish for a better future for all.  They are sure that they will manage that thanks to the help from the Fundación Paraguaya.

Nemesia, one of the members, sells fruit and vegetables at the group’s weekly fairs.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies that she wishes to use in the garden to grow vegetables.

loans.use: Buy garden supplies like seeds, fertilizer, hoses for watering, and others

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana María is a member of the Communal Bank "Miraflores", located in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of Ilave, and the department of Puno. She is 56 years old, married and has seven children. She has a primary school education.
Ana has worked with Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos, for six years. The first loan she took was for 500 PEN, and she used it to increase the capital in her business selling fuel. She is now asking for a new loan of 1,000 PEN, which will allow her to increase her business capital. Her dream is to be able to grow her business.
Ana's favorite thing about working with the Communal Bank is the savings and the money she is able to earn from them.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Responsabilidad Group

texts.es:
María Precila ella pertenece al grupo “RESPONSABILIDAD” donde tiene el cargo de secretaria, el cual esta conformado por 8 compañeras, Maria Precila vende ropa hace  6 años tiene un puesto de venta en un mercado de su zona, ella empezó en este  negocio ayudando a su cuñada pero con el tiempo decidió seguir sola poniendo su propia tienda de ropa, ahi ofrece a su clientela toda clase de ropas como polos, chompas, pantalones, blusas y vestidos. Lo que también ofrece a sus clientas es el pago a crédito por los productos que le compran, gracias a su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su esposo en la construcción de su casa para darle seguridad y comodidad a sus hijos también los ayuda en sus estudios.

Con el tiempo lo que mas quiere es trasladar su negocio a su propia casa y también incursionar en el negocio de la dulcería por que también se dedica esporádicamente a preparar tortas, bocaditos y toda clase de dulces, lo que hará con su préstamo es comprar ropa para esta campaña navideña ya que hay mucha venta.

Un socio se encuentra en la foto pequeña a mano derecha porque no estuvo presente en el momento de sacar la foto grupal.

*Maria precila esta vestida con chompa negra y polo plomo es la tercera de las sentadas.
texts.en:
María has been selling clothing for six years in a stall in the market in her area.  Her business is called "Cynthia".  She began this business helping her sister-in-law, but in time decided to continue alone with her own store.  She offers her customers all types of clothes like shirts, sweaters, pants, blouses, and dresses.  She also lets her customers buy items on credit.  Thanks to her work, she has been able to help her husband with the construction of their house, which will give safety and comfort to their children and help with their studies.

In the future, she would like to move the business to her own house and also begin a business selling sweets, because she also sometimes prepares cakes, snacks, and all kinds of sweets.  

With this loan, she will purchase clothing for the Christmas season, when she has many sales.  Like her eight partners, she is a member of the group "Responsabilidad" [Responsibility], where she holds the office of secretary.

One group member is pictured in the small photo in the top right hand corner because he was not present when the original group photo was taken. 

*María is the 4th person in the picture. She is seated.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua F. takes care of seven dependents. Efua makes donuts in Elmina, which she has been doing for eight years now. She is married to a cleaner. Efua uses her income to assist her husband with providing for the welfare of the family. The loan she hopes to get will be used to purchase more ingredients to prepare donuts to sell. Efua plans to reinvest her profits.

Donut mixture is in the green bowl pictured above. The donut mixture was used to fry the donuts being displayed.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare donuts

loans.name: Bakamwegha

texts.en: Bakamwegha is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with three children and rents a house in Kasese. He has been buying and selling passion fruit for the last seven years, however he has a challenge of long distances and the hilly landscape. His vision is to build his own house and open up a grocery in Kampala city. Bakamwegha intends to use the loan to buy passion fruit for resale.

loans.use: To buy passion fruit

loans.name: Jojit

texts.en:
Jojit N. is from the city of Dona Consuelo Ozamiz City. He is 34 years old. Jojit is married and has one infant.  To make a living, Jojit owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Jojit has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jojit joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jojit is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jojit from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Jaidy Leonor

texts.en:
32 year old Jaidy Leonor is a single mother. She lives with her two daughters (15 and 2) and one son (11) in Isla Trinitaria in the Southern part of Guayaquil. This area is known for having scant basic services and many dirt roads. Jaidy Leonor’s house is made of concrete and she has water and electricity. 

Jaidy Leonor’s husband left her before her youngest daughter was born. She needed to find a way to take care of her three children by herself so she took out a loan and set up her own business, selling clothes and crafts from door to door, and to friends and family members. 

Luckily things are going well in her business. On average she earns $400/month. Jaidy Leonor hopes to expand in the future and offer a bigger variety of products. She can count on her mother to help her.

Jaidy Leonor plans to use this $500 loan to buy more merchandise, mainly pants and shoes.

loans.use: To buy pants and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto Orizonto, 41 years old, is married and has 5 kids. His eldest is 25 years old, while the youngest is 11. He owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice crops. He and his wife sell his harvest at the market. His wife also maintains their small piggery in their backyard. Ernesto works hard to support the studies of his kids.

Ernesto is in need of additional piglets, feed and farm implements. He has applied for the loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. He is hopeful that this loan will help him improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets, feed and farm implements

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru: Юсупов Файзулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Файзулло имеет средне - специальное образование, механизатор. По специальности проработал 15 лет. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. Он в основном продает рыбу. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Fayzullo Y. lives in the Gissar Region. 48 years of age. Married, with four children. His wife is a homemaker. Fayzullo has a technical education; he is an agricultural machinery operator. He has worked in this area for 15 years. Currently he is a vendor at the central market of his region. He mostly sells fish. He has been in this line of business for 10 years. He is taking out a loan to increase his sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen S., 40, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. sells traditional kites, earning an income of 5 USD per day. Her husband produces wooden furniture, earning an income of 5 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 70 USD on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to expand her husband's business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To expand her husband's business

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene es productor lechero y también es constructor y su esposa lo ayuda con todas  las actividades agrícolas; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar su ganado lechero. Es la principal fuente de ingreso que tiene para mantener a su familia. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chijipina Chico del departamento de La Paz, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.
texts.en: Rene is a dairy producer and he is also a driver. His wife helps him with all of the agricultural activities. He requires a loan to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase his herd. It is his primary source of income to support his family. He lives in his own home located in Chijipina Chico in the department of La Paz. He is married and he has three children. He has been a client of Impro (Kiva Field Partner) since 2007.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. is a married woman with two school going-children. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past four yeas, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from her home to her neighbors and friends. As another source of income, Jane sells second-hand clothes, and that helps her meet her family's daily needs.

She decided to join Yehu microfinance because of its good reputation. With the KES 60,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal to sell. 

She dreams of establishing rental houses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Corina

texts.es: Corina tiene 35 años. Desde hace 13 años se dedica a una pulpería, negocio que atiende desde la mañana hasta en la noche, de esta manera su economía se ha estabilizado. Por lo que su necesidad de generar ingresos fue lo que la motivo ha establecer este medio de vida, tiene clientela fija y sus ventas son aseguradas por lo que tiene muchos deseos de seguir creciendo. Es su tercer crédito que está solicitando para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, pan, detergentes, sopas y enlatados. Desea obtener otro negocio en donde pueda brindar más ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en: Corina is 35 years old and for the past 13 years she has had a grocery store. She attends to her business from the morning until night time and this is how her finances have stabilized. She needed to generate an income so it is what motivated her establish this business. She has a loyal client base so her sales are secured and so she is very eager to keep growing. This is the third loan which she requests go purchase sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, bread, detergents, soups, and canned goods. She wants to establish another business from where to earn an additional source of income.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, bread, detergents, soups, and canned goods

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora J. is 30 years old and married. She has four children and all of them go to school. 

Currently, she in a business of selling cabbage. She borrowed a loan to stock more cabbage to sell. 

She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more cabbage to sell.

loans.name: Lenah Nyambura

texts.en:
Lenah is a 39 year-old married lady and a mother of three children, aged 9, 12, and 14 years old. She has been running her beauty shop for a period of about two years, with an income of 9,000 Kenya shillings a month.

She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD to buy beauty products for her shop. She hopes to give her children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her shop

loans.name: Gloria Libett

texts.es:
Doña Gloria, de 44 años de edad, es originaria del Departamento de León, esta casada, es madre de 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la costura. Ella inicio sus actividades de costura cuando ella tenia 20 años de edad, ella trabajaba en un taller de costura, en  donde elaboraba uniformes para algunas empresas privadas hacia uniformes para colegios, como camisas, shorts, pantalones ,faldas esto lo hacia medio tiempo, en su casa se dedicaba a hacer vestidos, trajes de vestir para niños , de hecho eso sigue haciendo hoy en  día , antes los hacia y  vendía ambulante. Hoy ella comercializa sus trajes en el mercado central de León, algunos pedidos que le hacen clientes conocidos, además cuenta con el apoyo que su esposo le  da para aportar en el hogar y fue así que preparo a sus hijos para que tuvieran una carrera universitaria. 
Ella solicito el préstamo para compra materia prima  como telas, hilo, agujas, zíper, botones. Esta inversión   será de mucha ayuda ya que así podrá mejorar La calidad de sus diseños, vender y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes   a la hora de elaborar uniformes y trajes de vestir. Ella quiere instalar un taller, comprar maquinas de coser, maquinas industriales para elaborar bordados y logotipos. De hecho su próxima meta es comprar una maquina de coser industrial para hacer diseños con bordados, ya que le gustaría presentar sus resultado en ferias municipales.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria, aged 44, lives in the department of León. She is married and the mother of three children. She is a seamstress. She began her sewing activity when she was 20. She worked in a sewing workshop where she produced uniforms for private companies that dealt with school uniforms like shirts, shorts, pants and skirts. That was a part-time job. In addition, she worked at home where she produced dresses and children's clothes. In fact, she is still active in the latter business, except that nowadays she sells her products at the central market in León, while earlier she used to sell them from door to door. She also takes orders from known customers. In addition, she can count on the support of her husband with household expenses and preparing their children for a university career.

Gloria applies for a loan to buy sewing materials, such as fabric, thread, needles, zippers and buttons. This investment will be very useful since it enables her to improve the quality of her dresses and offer a better service to her customers when she designs her uniforms, dresses and suits. She wants to install a workshop and equip it with sewing machines to make embroideries and logos. In fact, her next goal is to buy an industrial sewing machine for embroidery designs and sell her products at local fairs.

loans.use: to buy sewing material such as fabric, thread, needles, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old.  She is is a single lady who runs a hotel as her primary business and supplies eggs as her secondary business. She has been running her businesses for the last fifteen years, earning a profit of KES 20,000 per month.

Mary was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend.  This will be her seventh loan. With this loan, she plans to renovate her hotel and add space to hold  more chairs for customers. From her anticipated profits, she plans to open another hotel.

In the future, Mary hopes to open up a tourist hotel and accommodations. She is very hardworking and committed.

loans.use: renovate her hotel

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur grows different kinds of fruits and vegetables as well as raises cattle. He is 47 years old and has 2 children. 

Seymur was not happy with his previous job because he received little compensation for his work. So he went back to his village and decided to manage his small farm. In the year 2005, Seymur started managing his farm and raising cattle. He uses his harvest to buy the things his family needs. 

Seymur is asking for a loan of 1,200 AZN. He will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and cattle. The loan will help him increase his yield and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a married woman with a 5-year-old child. She is 34 years old. She has been engaged in farming for 12 years. She earns 5,000 PHP per month from farming. 

Julie requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides. Julie hopes for her business to be stable. She dreams for her child to be successful someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 43 year old Rwandan entrepreneur who is married. He has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 7. His wife sells clothing and all of his children are in school, apart from the youngest.

Elias runs a business selling second hand clothes and bedsheets. He began selling as a wholesaler but now sells in a retail facility. He will use this loan to purchase additional clothes and bedsheets that he will sell to meet the demands of his business.

With the profits from his business, Elias plans to renovate his house and provide food for his family

loans.use: to purchase clothes and bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Roberto Vinicio

texts.es:
Roberto es un joven de 32 años soltero que vive en la parroquia de Tumbaco en la ciudad de Quito. Hace tres años puso su negocio en la parroquia Pifo en el barrio "La Libertad". Es propietario de un local que brinda servicio de llamadas telefónicas, internet y además vende accesorios para teléfonos celular.

La jornada de Roberto es larga, al ser propietario de su negocio debe estar desde la apertura hasta el cierre todos los días, de 7am a 7pm. Tomó varios cursos para poder brindar el servicio de reparación de celulares, por lo que ahora necesita comprar repuestos y herramientas para poder hacerlo. Acudió a Fundación Alternativa para solicitar un crédito que le permita ampliar su negocio, él dará servicio de reparación a sus clientes y además comprará más accesorios para ofertar.

Nos cuenta que ha sido muy difícil empezar ya que ha tenido dificultad en conseguir capital de trabajo al ser un negocio nuevo pero ahora él se considera bien enrumbado y seguro de que podrá hacer que su negocio crezca. Él desea mejorar su calidad de vida, incrementar sus ingresos y así poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto is 32 years old and single.  He lives in the Tumbaco parish in the city of Quito.  Three years ago he set up his business in the Pifo parish in the La Libertad neighborhood.  He is the proprietor of a place that offers services for phone calls and the internet.  He also sells cell phone accessories.  

Robert’s work day is long.  As the proprietor of his business he has to be there from opening until closing every day from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m.  He took various courses to be able to offer the service of repairing cell phones.

However, he now needs to buy the replacement parts and the tools to be able to do so.  He went to the Fundación Alternativa to request a loan that will allow him to expand his business.  He will provide repair services to his customers, and he will also buy more accessories to sell.

He tells us that it has been very difficult to start because he had difficulty getting working capital as it was a new business.  Now he considers himself to be well on his way.  He is sure that he will be able to make his business grow.  

He wishes to improve his quality of live, increase his income, and to be able to help his family.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Catherine has a business selling yellow bananas (Cavendish).  She has been in this business for five years and she works six days out of every week. Catherine sells her products from home at retail and wholesale. Catherine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through houses for rent. The main business challenge(s) for Catherine include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing tomatoes and to own a delivery van. Catherine lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en: Antoine is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife, two school-aged children, and one brother. He has 15 years of experience working as a women's hairdresser and started running his own business six years ago. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will redecorate his salon in order to offer his clients a comfortable place. His wife, who works as a beautician, helps him with the household expenses, but they both need supplementary income to improve their standard of living. And that’s what they expect to get after renovating the shop.

loans.use: redecorate his salon in order to offer his clients a comfortable place.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en: Alla runs a hairdressing salon. She has been successfully running this business for past few years. Alla would like to renovate the salon's interior and provide services with more quality for her clients. With the requested loan, Alla plans to pay for the salon's renovation. An increase of the services' quality will help Alla meet her clients' demand and also attract new ones. Alla will increase her income and ensure a more stable future for her family. Alla lives together with her husband and two children.

loans.use: to pay for the salon's renovation.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: El sr. Samuel nacido en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Ahora vive en una localidad  a 32km de el Torno al en la comunidad de las Liras, su esposa la Sra. Cristina es ama de casa, tienen dos hijos, ellos viven y  trabajan en su misma parcela, ellos se dedican a la agricultura, siembran arroz, maíz y también se dedican a sacar madera para los carpinteros,  solicitaron un crédito para la compra de una motocicleta, por motivo que no hay transporte hasta su parcela y esto le dificulta al Sr. Samuel movilizarse a distintos lugares, por este motivo solicito el crédito ya que una motocicleta le será de mucha utilidad, los productos que siembran lo comercializan en el mercados de el Torno directamente del productor al consumidor, donde les va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela, es una persona trabajadora con muchas ganas de seguir adelante, agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Samuel was born in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra.  Now he lives 32 kilometers from el Torno in the community of Las Liras.  His wife Cristina is a homemaker and they have two children, who live and work on the same plot of land.  They work in agriculture, planting rice and corn and they also cut wood for the carpenters.  They requested this loan in order to purchase a motorcycle, since there isn't transportation to his property and this makes it difficult for Samuel to travel to different places.  For this reason, he requested the loan since a motorcycle would be very useful to him.  He sells the produce that they plant in the markets of el Torno, directly from producer to consumer, where it is going well since he has many customers.  He is a hardworking person with a great desire to succeed and grateful to the institution for the support being offered.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est  un homme âgé de 28ans. Il est marié  å une revendeuse. Il a 01 enfant. 
Koffi travaille comme revendeur de portables et accessoires dans un quartier de la place depuis 2002.
Koffi a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des portables et accessoires de portables.
texts.en: Koffi is 28 years old and married to a saleswoman. The couple have one child. Koffi has been selling mobile phones and mobile phone accessories in his district since 2002. He is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to restock on phones and accessories.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and mobile phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Tuichibai

texts.ru: Туйчибай целеустремленный и честный человек. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка и помогает мужу. Он занимается услугой таксиста. Также он занимается откормом скота и у него очень хороший опыт по данному бизнесу. Более 20 лет он занимается в данном бизнесе и ему помогает его жена и сыновья. Данный бизнес является семейным бизнесом. Туйчибай хочет улучшить свое жилищное условия и хотел бы получить займ в размере 12500 Сомони. Он планирует строит дом сыну, и покупать шифер для своего дома. Туйчибай заранее благодарить вас за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Tuichibai is a purposeful and honest man. He is married. His wife is a homemaker and helps her husband. He is a taxi diver and also feeds the cattle and has a very good experience in this type of business. For more than twenty years he has been in this business with help of his wife and sons. This is their family business. Tuichibai wants to improve his living conditions and wants to get a loan in the amount of 12500 somoni. He plans to build a house for his son and buy slates for the house. Tuichibai is thankful in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to purchase slates.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 19 years old.

Marissa is engaged in fishing. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him in their fishing business. Marissa sells all his catch at the market where she rents a stall. She requested this loan to purchase a boat engine and fishing nets. Marissa hopes to be able to sustain her children’s education through their business.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 39 years old and lives in Bintangan, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married with three children.  Jeana has a backyard piggery to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year.  She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase feed and medicines for her piggery.

Jeana has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.  Jeana hopes to become successful in her business and allow her children to finish studying.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medicines for her backyard piggery.

loans.name: Sweet S H G Group

texts.en:
Esther takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to be able to purchase land. In the recent 2011 season, Esther had a good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Esther was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Esther will ensure food security for her family and invest in livestock rearing to save for future use.

Esther is the facilitator of the Sweet SHG Group. She is pictured with her group members in the photograph. Esther and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Sweet SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Esther and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mauro Antonio

texts.es:
Mauro tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia, con esposa e hijos en una Comunidad ubicada a 30 minutos del distrito de Tambogrande perteneciente a Las Lomas; que corresponden a la Región Piura, ubicado a 4 horas  del departamento de Lambayeque. Esta comunidad se caracteriza por sus deseos  de superación. 

La actividad que desarrolla Mauro junto con su esposa, es la venta de chicha, cerveza, piqueos, en su propio domicilio, donde atiende los días viernes, sábados y domingos para lo cual ya tiene clientela establecida de la zona y aledaños. Además trabaja en parcelas cerca a su vivienda.  Su conviviente lo apoya en todas sus actividades que realiza, existiendo buena relación familiar para seguir creciendo en su negocio. Los ingresos que perciben lo utilizan para solventar los gastos familiares.

Mauro desea comprar insumos para la preparación de sus comidas y compra de más cerveza, esto con la finalidad de hacer crecer a su negocio.  Es por ello que para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1,000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa. 

Mauro cuenta con grandes deseos de superación y crecimiento en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mauro is 42, has a partner and three children.  He lives in a house he owns with his wife and children in a community located 30 minutes from the district of Tambogrande which belongs to Las Lomas, region of Piura located four hours from the department of Lambayeque.  This community is characterized for it's dreams to get ahead.

Mauro's business activity which he does together with his wife out of their home, is the sale of beer, chicha (an alcoholic drink made with corn flour and pineapple juice) and snacks, they are open Friday to Sunday and they have an established client base from their zone and surrounding areas.  He also works in a stable close to his house.  His wife supports him in the activities he does and they have a good family relationship that allows them to keep growing their business.  The income they earn is used to cover their family expenses.

Mauro wants to buy ingredients to make snacks and to buy more beer and this way grow the business.  To achieve this goal they request a loan of 1,000 new soles through Edpyme Alternativa.

Mauro has great dreams of getting ahead and growing the business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks and to buy beer for sale.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante lives in Estefania together with Felymar, his wife who takes care of their three children. Two of his children have settled into marriage, but sometimes they still rely on Dante and Felymar for their expenses. Dante is a loving father, so he is still earning an income at the age of 62. He owns a 1.5-hectare corn field and grows corn to sell.

He wants to improve his corn production and requires additional capital for inputs. He decided to borrow a loan amount of 30,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides.

In the future, Dante would like to have stable profits to use when emergency arises, as he and his wife are getting old and weak.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is 35 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has a one-year-old child. She stopped her education after 12th grade. Since 2010, she has been involved in a used clothes and shoes business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes and shoes for her business. She has many customers and makes a lot of profit. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes and shoes for her business

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mr. Sam, age 44, works as a construction worker in different places to generate income. His common-law wife helps earn income by sewing for a garment factory. The couple has been blessed with 3 school-aged children. 

Sam is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to fix his house which is in disrepair. He is very happy for this loan because it will help provide the whole family with comfortable living.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores tiene 42 años, convive con Ercilio de 32 años, con quien tiene 3 hermosos hijos. Juntos viven viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Dolores es una persona entusiasta experta para los negocios, ella se dedica en la venta de prendas de vestir, éste oficio viene realizando hace 8 años atrás. Ella al principio, sus prendas lo vendía en un mercado peuqeño de su ciudad, encima de unos maderos y plásticos cosa que le era dificultoso en trasladar las prendas, inclusive los tenía que doblar, empacar pues  por tanto manipular las prendas se maltratan. Pues ahora ya cuenta con un local propio y es gracias al ingreso de sus ventas que logró construirlo. Actualmente es conocida y todos sus clientes acuden a su puesto, esa es la ventaja que ella tiene pues está contenta con éste trabajo. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará mas prendas de vestir  y ampliara su local.
texts.en:
Dolores, 42, lives with Ercilio, 32; they have three beautiful children.  They live together in their own house located in the settlement of Canayre in Llochegua District.  

Dolores is an enthusiastic person expert in business.  She sells clothes.  She’s been in business for 8 years.  At the beginning, she sold her articles of clothing in a small market in her city on top of some boards and plastic which made transporting her clothes difficult.  She had to fold and pack them and with so much handling, they would become damaged.  Now, she has her own locale and thanks to income from the sales she managed to build it.  She is well-known now and all her customers come to her stand.  That’s her advantage and she’s happy with this work.

This will be her 4th MFP loan and she pledges to make her installment payments punctually.  She will use the 3000 new soles to buy articles of clothing and to enlarge her locale.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and to buy materials to enlarge her locale.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 36-year-old single woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 16 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be self-motivated. She operates a beauty salon where she provides services such as blow-drying and plaiting, and sells hair oil. She has been in this business for three years. Her business is located near a busy bus station. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase one blow dryer and hair chemicals. Within the next five years, Ann's business goal is to own three other beauty salons.

loans.use: To buy one blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Mrs.Otgonjargal is 35 years old and lives with her husband and her two children in ger district in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She also feeds her mother. Her mother retired at the moment. Her husband barber and her chilrens go to the school. She started hairdresser business in 2009. Now her business is sustainable and has many regular customers. She has been well-experienced in hairdresser business her town residents appreciates her a diligent woman. She is requesting 800,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital for hairdresser goods. She wants expand her business and own hairdresser's saloon.

loans.use: To increase her working capital for hairdresser goods

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
My name is Graciela B. B., and I am a barber who cuts hair for men, women and children. I have had my business for 4 years, I have many clients who prefer my haricut styles. My business generates an income that supports my family and the studies of my 4 children, who all help me to clean my store. My earnings I would obtain would help me to improve my store, to support my family and provide a better education for my children.

Loan Use: Purchase of electric machines to cut hair, scissors, combs, brushes, talc powders, gels, creams, oils, water, bags and mirrors.

Mi nombre es Graciela B. B., me dedico al corte de pelo para caballeros, niños y damas, tengo mi negocio desde hace 4 años, cuento con mucha clientela ya que les gustan los cortes de pelo que les hago, mi negocio me genera ingresos para sustentar mi familia y el estudio de mis 4 hijos, los cuales me ayudan a la limpieza de mi local. mi meta es incrementar mis herramientas de trabajo para brindar un mejor servicio, los ingresos que obtenga seran para mejorar el local, para el sustento de mi familia y una mejor educacion de mis 4 hijos.

loans.use: Compra de maquinas electricas de cortar pelo, tijeras, peines, cepillos, talcos, gel, crema, aceite, agua, fijador, bolsas, espejos.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en: Isabellla, 37, is married and has four children. Her husband also does farming. She joined SPBD Microcredit Programme in 2005 and that is the only organisation that she believes can help her and her business. She used her first loan to establish her taro farm in the village. Now, she is proposing to expand her farm and needs a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers and pesticides for her taro farm

loans.name: Seriye

texts.en: Seriye A. and her husband (her husband is pictured) own a few cows in the small village of Rehimli, in the Devechi Region of Azerbaijan. Seriye has applied for funding in order to invest in a few more calves for her current livestock. Seriye and her husband want to increase their livestock in order to grow their small livestock business and increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan C. and her husband live in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver, earning $2/day, while Mrs. C. sells Khmer noodles on the roadside, earning $3/day. Together, they have four children whom they support and send to school everyday.

This loan will be used to purchase a car so that they can start a new business of delivering freshwater to the provinces. The couple is confident that this business will be successful because all Cambodians need fresh water.

It is also an important business that will allow Cambodians to drink clean water and fall ill less frequently due to consuming unclean water. In the future, Mrs. C. hopes to make the freshwater delivery service her primary business, allowing her to end her current food business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for transporting freshwater to all provinces

loans.name: Siem

texts.en:
Siem is a widow with 8 children, 4 sons and 4 daughters. Six of her children are still in her care. One daughter is working in a garment factory and the others are still studying and helping her with farming. Siem never finished primary school, but she is reliable and clever at making her living. When she has free time, she makes and sells cakes to her neighbors.

Siem is asking for her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of US$ 500. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to repair her pump. Judging by her business activities, Siem should be able to pay back this loan without any problems.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer, pesticide, and fixing the pump

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E. is an experienced businesswoman. She studied her business for three years before she decided to open her own. She sells provisions and drinks.

She is 45 years old, a married mother of seven children, and lives in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for the past three years. She hopes to buy more provisions and drinks and increase her business turnover with the loan of $250.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks

loans.name: Muslum

texts.en: Muslum is a 46-year-old farmer who raises livestock in the southern region of Saatli. He is married and has two children. He started his business in 2002 when he purchased a cow and a calf. He is doing very well in his business selling calves for meat production to the local bazaar traders. The orders for calves have increased, and purchasers ask to buy more calves because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan. But fwith the money he has now, it is impossible to expand his business, so he applied for a 1200 USD loan. For this amount he is going to purchase four calves to raise.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

loans.name: Vicente Marcelino

texts.es:
Mr. Vicente D. is a gentleman with much experience in sales. Thirteen years ago, he started setting up a general store in the city of Chinandega. He started with his own capital, product of his hard work during his youth as a carpenter's helper.

It is important to point out that the business started with only a table on which he sold his products in his home, and it grew until it reached the larger size of his current business.

Mr. D. has experienced improvement for 5 years now, thanks to the loans from Ceprodel, which has supported him in rebuilding his business and stocking it. His goal nowadays is to increase his profit and to keep supporting his family with the food and support they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Vicente D. es un caballero de mucha experiencia en el área de las ventas. Desde hace 13 años comenzó con la implementación de una pulpería en la ciudad de Chinandega. Inició con un capital propio que lo obtuvo producto de su arduo trabajo desde su juventud como ayudante de carpintería.

Es digno señalar que el negocio comenzó con una mesa en la cual vendía sus pocos productos desde su hogar y así fue creciendo poco a poco hasta llegar a alcanzar mayores niveles de venta en su negocio. Desde hace 5 años el señor D. ha visto un avance debido a que ha realizado préstamos en Ceprodel de los cuales le han apoyado para reconstruir su negocio y poder surtir su cartera de productos. Su meta hoy en día es llegar a aumentar sus ganancias y seguir manteniendo su núcleo familiar con la alimentación y apoyo que su familia se merece.

loans.use: Buying products (Compra de productos)

loans.name: Fathulo

texts.ru:
Fathulo N. is 40 years old, has a high school education, is married and has 5 children. Fathulo owns a minivan that he uses to transport passengers. He has been in this business for 1 year. Fathulo will use his loan to fix his car and to purchase necessary parts. This loan will give him the opportunity to fix his car and provide passengers with comfortable, fast and inexpensive transportation around the city and local areas. He will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Нарзуллаев Фатхулло, возраст – 40 лет, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Фатхулло имеет свой собственный микроавтобус, на котором оказывает услуги по перевозки людей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 1 года. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на ремонт своей автомашины, то есть приобретение балонов и других запчастей. Этот кредит даст возможность Фатхулло отремантировать свой автомобиль, для того чтобы люди могли воспользоваться удобным, быстрым и недорогим транспортом для передвижения по городу или поездки в районы. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase parts for and repair vehicle

loans.name: Kabumbi Iii A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty K.. She is currently in the business of fresh food sales and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Betty is 41 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 8 children ranging from age 4 to 25 and six of her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy sacks of food from villages and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Betty N., Mary S., Rebecca K., and Molly N.. Betty N. has a business in clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Mary S. is currently operating a business selling breakables and wants a loan to make shelves. Rebecca K. operates a business selling firewood and wants to increase her inventory. Molly N. is currently in the business of selling cosmetics and is requesting a loan to purchase more lotions, oils and perfumes.

loans.use: To stock more fresh foods to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San H., age 53, is a widow who lives with her eight children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, She works on her farmland growing rice and generally earns around $1 a day. One of her children is married. Two children are employed as garment workers with a salary $75 each a month and one other son is a motor-taxi driver, making about $3 to $4 a day of profit. The rest stay at home and help her with farming. Now Mrs. San H., is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive as a business to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive as a business.

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Dương Thị Hằng is 36. She is a TYM fund member since 2001. She is married and has 3 children aged netween 3 and 12. With the loans from TYM, she invested in charcoal sales and construction material supply (lime). She has built brick ovens in her yard to make the lime. The material to make lime is stone which is transported by boat from Ninh Bình. The charcoal is bought and transported by boat from Quảng Ninh. Since there are a lot of construction projects in the region, all the lime production gets sold out all the time. Her income is about 300 USD a month. She is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to buy charcoal and stones.

Translated from Vietnamese by KH. Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Hằng, 36 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2001. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 3 con từ 2 đến 12 tuổi. Tham gia vào Quỹ, chị Hằng có điều kiện để đầu tư buôn bán than và vật liệu xây dựng. Tận dụng diện tích rộng chị Hằng xây dựng lò đốt vôi liên hoàn. Nguyên liệu dùng đốt vôi là đá được vận chuyển bằng đường sông từ Ninh Bình về. Bên cạnh đó than cũng được chuyển về theo đường sông từ Quảng Ninh. Hiện nay những công trình xây dựng của tư nhân trong vùng rất nhiều nên vôi của gia đình chị đốt xong đều bán hết. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Hằng khoảng 300USD. Vòng vốn này chị Hằng tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD để mua đá và than.

loans.use: Buy charcoal and stone

loans.name: Ndaata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ndaata G. is a member of the village bank of Mbousnakh in Thiès. She wants to increase her capital for her business selling cereals: millet, groundnuts, niébé (a type of peas), etc. The income from her business allows her to improve living conditions for her family and pay school fees for her children. Ndaata is requesting her 11th loan which will be reimbursed in one single repayment at the end of the loan term.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Ndaata G., mariée est membre du banc villageois de Mbousnakh à Thiès. Elle veut renforcer son capital pour le commerce de denrées alimentaires (mil, arachide, niébé, et autres). Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et de prendre en charge la scolarité des enfants. Ndaata sollicite un 11ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
purchase of cereals for re-sale

Achat pour revente

loans.name: Thi Vu's Group

texts.vi:
• Mrs. T. Thi Vu (ID number: 11030012), works as a nurse. She also works on rice field and breeds animals. At first, she borrowed 125 USD and profited from breeding pigs. This time, she wants to borrow 75 USD to buy more pigs. Her average income is 20 USD/week.
  • Mrs. V. Thi Tinh (ID number: 11030017), needs 150 USD to improve her family carpenter shop.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Tu (ID number: 11030014), needs 125 USD to buy pig mash.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hoa (ID number: 11030024), needs 125 USD to improve her famili carpenter shop.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hang (ID number: 11030015), needs 150 USD to buy pig mash. Every member of this group has finished repaying the money they borrowed before.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

    Chị Trần Thị Vụ (MS: 11030012). Chị Vụ làm y tá tại nhà ngoài ra chị còn làm ruộng, chăn nuôi. Kỳ một chị đã hoàn thành vốn vay 2.006.000 VND và thu được tiền lãi khá nhiều nhờ chăn nuôi lợn thịt. Nay chị muốn chuyển hướng sang chăn nuôi lợn nái nên vay 1.062.000 VND để mua lợn giống. Mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là 300.000 VND/ tuần. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm: Chị Vương Thị Tình (MS:11030017), vay 2.478.000 VND để gia đình phát triển nghề mộc. Chị Nguyễn Thị Tư (MS:11030014), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 11030024), vay 2.006.000 VND để phát triển nghề mộc. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng (MS: 11030015), vay 2.478.000 VND để mua cám lợn ( Tất cả các thành viên trong nhóm đã hoàn trả hết vốn vay kỳ trước).

loans.use: buy pigs and pig mash, improve carpenter shop

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe- Group4

texts.en:
Senaida A. has a business in which she buys and resells clothing that she has been operating for about 2½ years now with the help of loans from Esperanza. She has two children, 41 and 38, whom do not live with Mrs. A.. When not working with her clothing shop, she enjoys going to the beach and cooking, arroz con carne (rice with meat) being one of her favorite dishes. As Mrs. A. is in her elder years and has fully grown children, she simply wishes to sustain her business to support her and her husband.

Mrs. Senaida A. is a member of an eight person group, Group 4, that is part of a larger micro-bank called Mujeres D. Fe, "Women of Faith" in English. In the picture, Mrs. A. is third from the right along with members of her group and some others of Mujeres D. Fe. Her story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of micro-credit loans of Esperanza. Together, this group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. The concept of group lending is to have loans paid in a group to reduce the risk of a person defaulting, as others pick up where a person may lag to receive the next loan. Each of the associates in this bank has a similar business whether it is a motor taxi service or selling cosmetics. Thank you for your support and awareness of this issue, and it is your concern and efforts that is able to bring a difference to the lives of people such as Mrs. A..

loans.use: This group of women would like a loan for their various businesses, from buying clothing and cosmetics for resale to operating a motor taxi service.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina M. is married and has two kids. She lives with her family at Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is 35 years old.  She runs a clothing shop and has been selling jeans, blouses and skirts, women's slippers, and dressing bags for the past four years. Faustina needs a loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her purchase a large quantity of good quality merchandise to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies' clothing, and slippers

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika M. is 51 years. She is married with 4 children. Malika is an older woman who is working hard to reach a better lifestyle and rise out of poverty. Despite of her ripe old age, her energy shines in her activity.

Malika has a large family with several grandchildren. Since 1994, she has been engaged in bicycle spare parts sales. She has a stall in the local market. She sells spare parts of different types and for various bicycles. As a result of the success of her business, Malika has improved the living conditions of her family and is doing her best to meet all the needs of her dearest grandchildren.

Now she is not satisfied with the volume of sales and wants to increase her stock of inventory, thus increasing the volume of sales. With this purpose today Malika requests 3500 Somoni (1025 USD) for a term of 6 months. She is planning to spend the loan purchasing spare parts for bicycles so as to increase her range of goods. With your help this will be possible. Be an important part of the growth of Malika’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for bicycles to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Vumilia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Vumilia L. from Mbeya. She is married with two children, aged 3 and 5. Vumilia has been running a shoe business since 2003. Her business is to buy shoes in whole sale and resell them in retail. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee and her husband. She currently earns about $300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400USD in order to purchase additional stock of shoes. In the future, she plans to open another business. Vumilia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Lending. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a lending microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microlending is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Vumilia would like to purchase additional stock of shoes.

loans.name: Adoté

texts.fr: Marié et père de deux enfants, Adoté A. est coiffeur de profession. Il est connu dans le village pour le fait qu’il est très expérimenté dans l’art de coiffer. Mais malheureusement ses matériels de travail sont très  vétustes, ce  qui ne lui permet pas d’exercer son métier dans les conditions normales. Pour cela, il sollicite ce crédit pour renouveler ses outils de travail afin de faire plus de revenus et récupérer ses clients qui ne sont plus au rendez-vous ces derniers temps le laissant dans la misère, dans de conditions de vies très pénibles.
texts.en:
Married and the father of two children, Adoté A. is a barber by trade. He is known throughout the village for his expertise in the art of barbering; unfortunately, however, his work implements are so old that they do no permit him to practice his profession as it should be done. To rectify this, he is requesting a loan to refurbish his equipment with the goal of increasing his income and attracting back the customers that have not returned of late, leaving him in abject poverty and dire straits.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for his barber shop

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El señor Julio es una persona que se dedica a trabajar de cocinero en un conocido restaurant de la ciudad y ademas realiza platillos para su venta como ayuda extra, el esta requiriendo este credito para terminar el proyecto del enjarre de las paredes de su casa, ya que quiere recibir a su familia que vienen a visitarlo, un hogar mas acogedor y se sientan comodos en esta navidad.
texts.en:
Julio makes a living working as a cook in a well-known restaurant in his city and also makes his own meals to sell for extra income. He is requesting this loan to finish replastering the walls of his home since he wants to welcome visiting family members in a more friendly home and for them to feel comfortable this Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replaster the walls of his home

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
There are three members who make up this loan group, and they all reside in Pleung Chess Rotest village of Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Sor S. has been selected to be the leader. She is a local cultivator and is 48. She is growing traditional rice that is the main source for her to earn the money to properly support her family. She is married and is currently responsible for six children: three are single and three are married; two of them are students.

To help meet the family's expenses, three of her children are employed, two as construction workers and another one is a garment worker, while her husband is a local construction worker. In view of the coming harvesting season, Sor S., lacking the money to pay for her harvesting activities, decided to ask for a loan as capital to hire a harvester to harvest her rice crop.

The other two borrowers are:

Mrs. Bo V., 41 years old, who is also a rice farmer. She is applying a loan to pay for her rice crop harvesting.

Mr. Ouch K. earns a living driving a motorcycle taxi and is seeking a loan to hire a harvester to harvest his rice.

loans.use: to hire a harvester to harvest her rice crop

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn S. lives in Barangay Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Evelyn is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. One of their children was able to graduate college and find a job in a department store at Cebu City, which fulfilled their dreams.

Evelyn and husband still strive hard and struggle because they have 3 more children who haven’t finished school yet. But Evelyn stay positive. “It’s a matter how you deal with the situation” she said. Evelyn thought of fishing to raise money, as it is acommon and usual source of income of most people in their barangay. She needs PHP 15,000 to purchase a new fishing boat. Her husband will fish while Evelyn will take care of their children. The amount that they request could be a great help for them to achieve their dream.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa A. is a hair dresser who owns a beauty salon at Abura. Theresa has received primary level education.  She is a single parent and has 5 dependants.  Theresa has been a hair dresser since about 2 years ago. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of hair products to meet the demand of her costumers who come to the salon. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of  her trade .

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy a variety of hair products to meet the demand of her costumers who come to the salon.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Grace F. L. from Dar es Salaam. She is a widow with one child, who is one year old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Grace has been running a pharmacy since 1997. She works at the business for 16 hours per day, seven days per week. Grace currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase medicines in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. Grace thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase medicines in bulk

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de huit femmes, les membres du groupe Sabougnouma sont mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans et de 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles  dans le village de TINGOLE, sous préfecture de FANA, dans la préfecture de DIOÏLA région de KOULIKORO république du Mali.  
Par des liens de parenté et de mariage, ces femmes se sont connues et font comme activité génératrice de revenus la restauration dans des gargotes à TINGOLE.
Dans l’intention de rehausser le niveau de leur activité elles ont adhéré au programme crédit de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe dont quatre prêts agricoles. Les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés.
 Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt 500 kg de riz, 300 kg de maïs, 200 kg d’arachide et une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires. Les plats cuisinés (couscous, riz avec sauces, arachide grillé etc.) sont vendus dans leurs gargotes à TINGOLE à une clientèle est composée de manœuvres, d’apprentis chauffeurs et bien d’autres personnes.
Ces femmes comptent obtenir chacune  un bénéfice par cycle de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé dans leurs activités de restauration.
texts.en:
Composed of eight women, the members of the group Sabougnouma are married and average 24 years of age and 2 children. The live in traditional conjugal families in the village of TINGOLE in FANA sub-prefecture (DIOÏLA prefecture, KOULIKORO region) in the Republic of Mali. Through ties of kinship and marriage, these women came to know one another. They earn revenues from catering food in eateries in TINGOLE.

With the intention of boosting their level of business, the group members joined the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their sixth group loan. Four of these loans included agricultural loans. The preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

With this loan, the group members plan to buy 500 kg of rice, 300 kg of corn, 200 kg of peanuts, and a large quantity of condiments. The prepared dishes (couscous, rice with sauces, roasted peanuts, etc.) are sold in their eateries in TINGOLE to customers composed of laborers, driver apprentices, and many other people.

These women each intend to earn a profit of 40,000 francs CFA per cycle. The profits will be used in their restaurant businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurants

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses O. is forty years old and married with five children. He is a tailor. He is requesting a loan of $275 to purchase more tailoring materials for making clothes for his customers. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring supplies

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr: Madame akpo aicha exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de bijoux, elle fait cette activité depuis 2007 et s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Ghana, son stock est épuisé, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit pour acheter 40montres en bracelet pour dame, 50 gourmettes, et 40 boucles d’oreilles. Elle est mariée et a 01 enfant.
texts.en:
Ms. Akpo Aicha earns an income from commerce in jewelry. She has been in this business since 2007 and acquires supplies in Benin and in Ghana. Because her inventory is exhausted, she would like to resupply herself and is requesting from WAGES her second loan to buy 40 bracelet watches for women, 50 chain bracelets, and 40 earrings. She is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
