Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 1 Group

texts.en:
With four children and 14 grandchildren, Altagracia is an absolutely wonderful grandmother who is currently on her seventh loan cycle with Esperanza. She owns a little building next to her house from which she sells gasoline to the passing motorcyclists and vehicles. She also offers repairs and she supplements these sales with her own homemade cookies, sweets and other treats. One of Altagracia’s grandchildren, Leonard, helps her with running the business when it comes to repairing motorcycles. Much of his time is spent working on motorcycles and repairing them, while Altagracia focuses on the sales of the gasoline and baked goodies.

Altagracia is excited to see her business continue to grow. Through the loan cycle progression at Esperanza, she was able to buy the little building next to her house and she has continually increased her inventory. Most recently, her loan has gone to buying gasoline, baking goods and parts for repairing motorcycles. She loves her business and for now is almost completely focusing on its growth and putting extra profits back into her enterprise. However, in the future, Altagracia wants to fix up her home a little bit, including finishing off a cement floor throughout her entire house. For now, most of her house has a floor – but some of it is still dirt.

Altagracia (second from left) is the coordinator of this group of five women within the Mujeres Unidas Bank of Hope near Samaná, Dominican Republic. Altagracia is very thankful for any help you can provide!

loans.use: To buy gasoline, motorcycle parts and baking supplies

loans.name: Hushvaht

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Хушвахт  Бобоев занимается животноводством, дома у него 7 голов крупнорогатого скота. Проживает Хушвахт в городе Истаравшане.
С раннего утра Хушвахт готовит корм своему скоту, его жена доит молоко и поит скот. Так начинается утро Хушвахта и его семьи. В течении дня ухаживать за скотом ему помогает брат Суюнбой.
Дополнительно Хушвахт занимается сельским хозяйством. Он запрашивает сумму в размере 2000 сомони, для того чтобы использовать ее для откорма скота.
texts.en:
Hushvaht B. is involved in animal husbandry. He has 7 heads of cattle at home. Hushvaht lives in the city of Istaravshan. Early in the mornings, Hushvaht prepares feed for his livestock, and his wife milks the cows and gives them water. This is how mornings start for Hushvaht and his family. His brother, Suyunboi helps him look after the livestock during the day. In addition, Hushvaht is involved in agriculture. He is requesting a loan in the sum of 2000 somoni to use it for feeding livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding livestock

loans.name: Help The Poor (Malana) Group

texts.en: Upon completing high school, G. got involved in the sale of dry goods (rice, oil, onions, etc.) and has been in the business for the past 3 years. His greatest challenge was at the beginning of the business when there was no financal help at all.  He’s currently dreaming of extending the size of his table in the market and purchase more goods and also wants to continue his schooling.

loans.use: buying rice, oil, onions, etc. for resale

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna P. is from the village of Lugait Mismis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Lorna is married and has 15 school-age children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a business, making and selling specialty food products in the local community. Lorna has been in business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 31 years old. Mercy is married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mercy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Angélica

texts.es: Rosa Angélica C. D. G. resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Rosa tiene 66 años D. edad vive con su hija y su pequeño nieto. Rosa es madre soltera ha sido muy trabajadora y responsable para darle lo mejor a su hija, hace veinte años instalo una tienda la cual hasta el día D. ahora es la que genera el ingreso fijo D. Rosa, el deseo D. ella es seguir en su negocio y es por ello que solicita este crédito, para surtir su tienda la cual necesita D. mercadería nueva para mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa Angélica C. D. G. resides in the department of Ahuachapán. Rosa is 66 years old and lives with her daughter and young grandson. Rosa is a single mother and has been very hard working and responsible so that she could give her daughter the best. Twenty years ago she set up a store, and to this day she generates an income for herself. Her desire is to continue her business. It is for that reason she requests this loan, to stock her shop which needs new merchandise to improve sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Joshua's Group

texts.en: Joshua W. is 36 years old and married with three kids. He is the leader of his group in Mukono. Joshua would like to use this loan of 300,000 USH to expand his business and buy the proper supplies to begin sand quarrying.

loans.use: more construction supplies

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 37 years old and is married to Mary Wanjiru. They have 4 school-going children. He has run his small retail business in Naivasha town for the past year.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy more retail products to sell in his shop in order to boost business and draw in more customers. He hopes to enter the transport business some day and buy his own cab to increase his income.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more retail products to sell in his shop

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie D. is from the village of Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 29 years old. Girlie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Girlie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from her "sari-sari store " general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, sugar, candies,salt, eggs,soap & toothpaste in the local community. Girlie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Girlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Girlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Girlie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the  loan taken out by Girlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and used for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresa Victoria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Manuelita Sáenz se reúne en barrio Jocay de la ciudad de Manta en la costa de Ecuador, Manta es el primer puerto atunero de Sudamérica es una zona de mucho movimiento económico.

La señora Teresa Z.  es oriunda de Quevedo en la provincia de Los Ríos, llegó a vivir a Manta hace 20 años, aquí  formó su familia, actualmente se encuentra casada  y tiene tres hijos jóvenes universitarios, el esposo es de profesión chofer que trabaja en un taxi en la ciudad.

Teresita es una mujer dedicada a la costura, de profesión modista, se preparó cuando era muy joven sus padres fueron los que la impulsaron a que estudie y se prepare, se graduó en  esta profesión y desde hace 5 años trabaja en éste arte, confecciona ropa deportiva, vestidos de novia y ropa intima,  en su casa  tiene un pequeño taller, ella diseña los modelos de sus prendas,  cuenta que ahora el  negocio está un poco bajo porque algunas personas prefieren comprar la ropa ya confeccionada por eso opto por confeccionar y entregar a almacenes para que comercialicen sus diseños, cada prenda tiene un costo de 30, 50 o 70 dólares dependiendo del diseño y la complejidad de confeccionarlo.

 Teresa está solicitando un nuevo préstamo a la Fundación para invertir en  la compra de  telas, hilos, botones, cierres, y otros implementos para la confección de sus prendas  y entregar a tiempo los  nuevos pedidos, para ello  ella  viaja hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil  y Portoviejo para adquirir la materia prima por un costo aproximado de 800 hasta 1000 dólares en cada  compra.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Manuelita Sáenz" meets in the Jocay neighborhood in the city of Manta on the coast of Ecuador. Manta is the first tuna port in South America and it is an area with a lot of economic activity.

Señora Teresa Z. is a native of Quevedo in the province of Los Ríos. She came to Manta to live 20 years ago and formed her family here. She is currently married and has three young children who are in college. Her husband is a taxi driver in the city.

Teresita is a woman who makes a leaving by sewing and designing. She learned when she was very young and her parents motivated to study and practice. She graduated and has worked for more than 5 years in this field. She makes athletic clothing, wedding dresses, and lingerie. She has a workshop in her home where she makes her designs. She tells us that her business is a little low right now because some people prefer to buy clothing that is already made, and that is why she chose to make and deliver her designs to department stores. Each piece of clothing costs $30, $50, or $70 depending on the design and how complex it is to make.

Teresa is requesting a new loan from the Fundación to invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and other items to make her clothing so she can deliver her orders on time. She will travel to Guayaquil and Portoviejo to acquire these materials at a cost of approximately $800-1,000.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies like fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, and more to make her designs

loans.name: Murotjon

texts.en:
Murotjon R. is 27 years old and he lives with his wife and three children.  He has grown vegetables and wheat for more than four years.  His small plots are close to his home, which gives him plenty of time to care for his crops, family and children. The hard part is transporting his products into cities to sell, because of the scarcity of buses.  Murotjon gets most of his enthusiasm from his family. He will use his loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer, to increase his production and therefore his income. With your help, Murotjon will get ahead. He is counting on your help. 

--------------------------------------
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
--------------------------------------
IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds  fertilizer for sowing wheat and seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Vicente Rodolfo

texts.es:
Vicente Vélez de 40 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento tiene dos servicios básicos como agua y luz sin alcantarillado, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio con ella tiene 5 hijos uno de 15 años, 13 años, 11 años, 9 años, 6 años todos estudiantes de una escuela fiscal. 

Vicente comenzó hace 12 años atrás con el negocio de la tienda para que su esposa y el trabajen juntos, ahora Vicente hace las compras y su esposa atiende la tienda desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h30 de lunes a domingos, venden arroz, pollo, verde, aceites etc. Una de las complicaciones son los ladrones en su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceites, azúcar, atún, pollos para poder agrandar mas el negocio, en el futuro quiere arreglar su casa para que cada  uno de sus hijos tenga su propia habitación.
texts.en:
Vicente Vélez, age 40, lives in a suburban zone in Paraíso de Guayaquil. His cement house has the two basic utilities– light and water– but no sewage system. His wife helps him with his business, and together they have 5 children, ages 15, 13, 11, 9, and 6, who are all students at a public school. Vicente opened his store 12 years ago so that he and his wife could work together. Now, Vicente does the shopping, and his wife works in the store from 6:00 a.m. until 9:30 p.m. Monday through Sunday. They sell rice, chicken, fresh vegetables, oils etc. One setback are the thieves in their area. With this loan, Vicente wants to buy oil, sugar, tuna, and chicken in order to expand their business. In the future, he wants to remodel his house so that one of children can have their own room.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, oil, and tuna

loans.name: Ely

texts.es:
Ely, de 32 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en una habitación alquilada junto a su querido hijo y lo que más desea es brindarle un buen futuro.
Su negocio es la confección de ropa para niños. Desde muy joven incursionó en este trabajo y ahora tiene su propio taller de confecciones donde elabora prendas infantiles, la cuales posteriormente lleva a vender a su puesto, donde son compradas rápidamente.
Lo que más le gusta a Ely de su trabajo es confeccionar prendas para los niños más pequeños, ya que le causan mucha ternura, lleva 6 años realizando este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es darle el acabado a las prendas, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado y paciencia. 
Para el futuro, espera comprar mejor maquinaria y aumentar su producción.

Este es el primer préstamo de Ely con MFP, está muy decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria con las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales para confeccionar una mayor cantidad de ropa.
texts.en:
Ely, 32 years old, is a very hard-working and happy woman. She lives in a rental house with her beloved son and what she most desires is to offer him a good future. Her business is making children's clothes. When she was very young, she became involved in this work and now, she has her own sewing shop where she makes outfits for infants, which she then takes to her stall and they are rapidly purchased. What Ely likes most about her work is to make outfits for the smallest infants, becuase they create tender feelings. She has been doing this work for 6 years and the most difficult part is finishing the outfits, which requires much care and patience. In the future, she hopes to buy a better sewing machine and increase her production. This is Ely's first loan with MFP. She is committed to making her payments on time, since she wishes to borrow again in the future. She is a very active member of her communal bank who feels solidarity with other members. With the 1,000 New Sols she is requesting she will buy new materials so she can make a larger quantity of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY TEXTILES FOR SEWING INFANT OUTFITS

loans.name: Srey Oun's Group

texts.en:
This group bank loan consists of four members and Mrs. Srey Oun M. has been selected by the members, each of whom will use their loan for a different purpose. All the members live in Sam Raong village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Srey Oun M. is 28 years old and is the mother of two children who are too small to study or work. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare (2.5-acres) of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family living. Her husband, Mr. Bun Chhean Chhoen, is a tobacco seller.

In order to improve the conditions of her family living, Mrs. Srey Oun M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more tobacco for her husband to sell, which can generate high profits.

loans.use: To buy more tobacco for her husband to sell

loans.name: Gwenotwom C Lalam Christine Group

texts.en: L. Christine is a business woman who is 38 years old and single. She has four children in school. She has owned a grocery store for three years. She is using the loan to purchase grocery items such as tomatoes, charcoal and eggplant to sell. She is adding capital into her business. Her future hope is to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for land

loans.name: Yelba Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Yelba Argentina L. Ampié, tiene la edad de 25 años, vive con su esposo, en el humilde Barrio San Ignacio, ellos son una familia de 4 miembros, y dentro de los principales sueños que tienen para la familia, está el mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ellos son agricultores desde hace 5 años.

Fue con el apoyo de su papa, que comenzaron a cosechar y uno de los principales problemas que han tenido, ha sido la afectación de las plagas y las enfermedades de las tierras, es por esta razón que el solicita un préstamo para la compra de fungicidas y abonos, para brindarle mantenimiento a su producción, esto les traerá un aumento en el volumen de sus ventas y de esta  forma mejores condiciones económicas para futuros proyectos que les favorezcan a su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sra. Yelba Argentina Lopez Ampie, 25, lives with her husband in the humble neighborhood of San Ignacio. Her family of 4 has lots of dreams for the future but one of the most important is to improve their standard of living. They have operated a farming business for the last 5 years. They started their first crop with help from her father but the soil is exhausted and they have problems with pests so they need a loan in order to buy pesticides and fertilizers. By improving their output, they can increase their sales and, in turn, their economic condition and future financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticides for farming business.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji E. is 29 years old and married to a driver. She has two children who both go to school. Keji is currently in the business of selling dried fish and tomatoes at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock onions and cooking oil to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build up a shop.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock onions and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Hom

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is 32 years old and since 1979 has earned a living as a farmer on a plot of land that she owns. She grows all kinds of produce and is able to raise two crops a year. She is also the devoted mother of three children; all of them are living with her in the family home. 

K. has been married for many years to Mr. Seang Thei, 40, who earns an income from farming. K. has requested this loan to grow crops as the rainy season is coming.

loans.use: To grow crops

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo is married with 4 children and they are doing well in their respective school. She is 39 years of age and she lives with her husband who is a civil servant in Lagos. She sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks. She works hard to make sure there is food on her children’s table. She opens her shop every day of the week in order to make more sales and profit. She started the business since 15 years ago and she like the nature of the business. 

She needs more capital to invest into the business, she is requesting for the loan amount of NGN50, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and groceries to sell. She promise to pay promptly and says thanks to Kiva and LAPO for their wonderful initiatives.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Grupo Hatarinas Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Hatarinas” se encuentra ubicada en la zona de El Agustino, departamento de Lima, está conformado por 10 socios, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 1 año. Sus miembros realizan diversas actividades de producción, comercio y servicio.
María del Carmen quien a su vez asume el cargo de presidenta, tiene 44 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos en edad académica, se dedica a la venta de café en granos y servicio de internet desde hace 1 año, se inicio ya que como ella vendía productos de belleza y tenia clientes decidió vender café en invierno y tuvo una buena acogida, así que decidió continuar en esta actividad, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria María del Carmen ha comprado artefactos para su vivienda y esencialmente ha apoyado en la educación de sus hijos, ya que desea que sean profesionales. El reciente préstamo lo utilizará en el título profesional de su hija.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y están comprometidos a cumplir con los pagos según el cronograma otorgado por prosperidad. (niños en la foto, hijos de los socios)
texts.en:
The Hatarinas Communal Bank is located in the El Agustino area in the Lima department. It is comprised of ten members. They have been working with Edapropa-Prosperidad for one year. The members do diverse activities in production, commerce and service. María del Carmen is the president. She is 44, married, and has three school age children. She has been selling coffee beans and providing internet service for one year. She started because she sold beauty products, and she had customers. She decided to sell coffee in the winter, and it was well received. So, she decided to continue this activity. With the effort of her daily work, María del Carmen has bought appliances for her home. She has essentially helped with her children’s education because she wants them to become professionals. She will use the loan for her daughter’s professional certificate. All of our members are grateful for the support, and they are committed to making their payments according to Prosperidad’s timeline. (The children in the photo are the members’ children.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her daughter’s professional certificate

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en: Mekie K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Women. She is 37 years old, single and has three children between nine and 19 years old, all of them in school. She also cares for one sibling. Mekie was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties. For 10 years, she has been selling used clothes on Camp Johnson Road, down town Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. Her hope is to improve her business and take good care of her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Lenie's Group

texts.en:
Lenie T. is from the village of D'ban. She is 44 years old. Lenie is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or default.

Lenie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling dry goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately $60 a month from this activity.

In 2004, Lenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for her children's education. Lenie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 13th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda E. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old. Erminda is married and has two adult children. Erminda owns and operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling banana cue in the local community. Erminda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Erminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from GDMPC, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Erminda is now requesting her second loan from GDMPC, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San T., aged 46, lives in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. She is also a Khmer cake maker. Her husband, Mr. Ban Chay, is a construction worker and also a palm juice collector.
Mrs. San T.'s problem is that she does not have enough oxen to plow her land. To solve this problem, Mrs. San T. is seeking a loan to buy two oxen to plow her field. Through farming the couple support three children who all study at the local public school and help their parents in their businesses. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to plow her field

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, fish, meat, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Lluvia De Luz Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Lluvia de luz. El nombre del grupo se debe a que la comunidad se caracteriza por tener lluvias constantes gran parte del año. Está ubicado en Puebla en México.  El grupo está conformado por 11  integrantes.
Juana L. E. es tesorera  del grupo. Tiene 43 años, estudió hasta el tercer  año de primaria, es casada tiene en total seis hijos una mujer y cinco varones.  Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, negocio que inicio hace quince años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de pastura y forraje, con la finalidad de seguir teniendo animales en buen estado. Sus clientes consideran que es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable,  y es reconocida en la localidad por  contar con el ganado mejor cuidado, debido a gran experiencia que tiene en la crianza de ganado. Se siente contenta y agradecida con el servicio y trato que la financiera le proporciona al otorgarle un préstamo ya que debido al sector al que pertenece es difícil adquirir un crédito. Con sus ganancias pretende construir un mejor establo y así poder adquirir mas ganado, y al hacer crecer su negocio podrá al ampliar la recamara de sus hijo para que puedan estar mas cómodos

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:

Margarita R. C.		Venta de tortillas a mano	
Juana L. E.		Ganadería.
Letisia S. F.	 	Venta de ropa
Andrea C. R.		Venta de tortillas a mano
Blanca Y. C. C.		Cooperativa escolar
Rafaela R. B.		Ganadería
Claudia O. A.		Ganadería
Isabel A. L.		Fonda
Eustolia A. G.		Ganadería
Guadalupe M. C.	        Venta de productos lácteos
Julia R. P.		Ganadería
texts.en:
This group is called “Lluvia de Luz” (Raining Light), because the community is known for constant rains during a major part of the year. It's located in Puebla and is composed of 11 members. Juana is treasurer of the group. She is 43 years old and studied until the 3rd year of primary. Juana is married and has a total of 6 children, 1 female and 5 males. Juana buys and sells cattle, a business she started 5 years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy pasture and fodder, for the purpose of keeping her animals in good condition. Juana's customers consider her a very hard-working and responsible person, and she is recognized in her locality as having the best cared for cattle due to the great experience she has in raising cattle. Juana feels content and gratified with the service and treatment that this institution provides, in view of the fact that it is difficult to obtain credit in this economic sector. With her earnings, Juana intends to construct a better stable and thus, to be able to acquire more cattle. By making her business grow, she can expand her sons' bedroom so that they can be more comfortable. The remaining members of the group are: Margarita R. C. Selling hand-made tortillas Juana L. E. Cattle raising Letisia S. F. Selling clothing Andrea C. R. Selling hand-made tortillas Blanca Y. C. C. Student coop Rafaela R. B. Cattle raising Claudia O. A. Cattle raising Isabel A. L. Inn Eustolia A. G. Cattle raising Guadalupe M. C. Selling milk products Julia R. P. Cattle raising

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PASTURE AND FODDER FOR CATTLE

loans.name: Tumurbat

texts.en:
Tumurbat P. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. He and his family have been living in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, for the past ten years. His older daughter attends a local secondary school. 

Tumurbat operates a shoe repairing business in his town, with the help of his wife. He repairs boots and shoes in a local main market of his town. He purchases a large amount of raw materials at a time from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, that can used for two to three months in his business. He is a very hard working man and says, "I try my best to expand my business and to save money for the future." 

He is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT ($1350) loan in order to purchase more raw materials at wholesale prices, such as leather, fabric, heels and glue.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita R., 51, is a rice grower and has operated her business for quite a long time now. She envisions her children having a proper education and this is why she works harder to earn more. She owns a hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field and hopes to have a huge income to uplift her family’s living conditions.

Lolita joined CEVI for the purpose of having a business of her own and to sustain her family’s basic needs. This loan will be used to supply her farm needs like fertilizer, pesticides, and other supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm needs like fertilizer, pesticides, and other supplies

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Bolivar in the district of Cajamarca. This is a mountainous region in the northern part of Peru. It is primarily populated by individuals who raise corn.
Behind his house Marcos raises small animals such as ducks and chickens. The animals yield eggs, which Marcos uses to feed his family and sell, and meat when they reach the appropriate size.
Marcos has taken out loans from our institution before. He has always paid them back punctually. Furthermore, he and his family are well known and respected in the zone. Marcos plans to use this loan to purchase additional animals and replenish his stocks of feed. He is thankful for the opportunity to take out a loan at a lower cost due to its financing through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals and feed

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Borrower Tungalag is 26 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on her father’s plot of land. Her husband operates a retail business by construction. 

Tungalag operates a construction materials trade business in a rented stall at the largest market in Ulaanbaatar. She started her business in 2006 with capital of 500.000 MNT. After several years of operation, she has gained a lot of experience. With her earnings, she has been providing money for family expenses and is planning to build a new house in the future. Tungalag is an open-minded person who has very good communication skills. She is requesting 1.000.000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies for her construction materials trade business

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her construction materials trade business.

loans.name: María José

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a  la señora María José, ella tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos de 10 – 9 y 4 años, los mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor en el jardín de infantes. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo de las marcas Nivi y Unimoda,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y su forma de vender es enseñar la revista y allí sus clientes deciden que comprar, luego ella realiza los pedidos a la distribuidora en Quito o Guayaquil y recibe los productos en Rocafuerte en la cooperativa de transporte Reina Del Camino, trabaja cuatro días a la semana tres horas al día, dice que lleva ya en su negocio cerca de 6 años y que empezó gracias a la ayuda de una amiga que la impulso a que empiece en este negocio.

Este crédito es para pagar los pedidos que ha realizado y que están a punto de recibir. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las comodidades que brinda la institución. Su meta es  incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
We met María José in Rocafuerte. She is 29 years of age and lives with her life partner with whom she has three children of 10, 9 and 4 years of age. The older children go to school, and the youngest attends kindergarten. Her husband is a merchant. 

As well as a being a great housewife, María José works selling Nivi and Unimodo brand clothes from a catalogue.  She sells door to door. After her customers choose their preferred items from the magazine, María José places their order with distributors in Quito or Guayaquil.  The clothes are later delivered to Rocafuerte via the Reina del Camino transport cooperative. She has been working three hours a day, four days a week for close to six years. She started the business thanks to the help of a friend who encouraged her.

María José will use this loan to pay for the orders she has already placed, which she about to receive payment for. This is her fourth cycle with the community bank. She likes the services that the institution offers. Her goal is to increase her business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes

loans.name: Renovacion Las Aguilas 1, 4 & 5 Group

texts.es:
Nieve es una de los miembros del Grupo Renovacion las Aguilas 1,4 & 5, compuesto por 15 micro-empresarios, todos están dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, venta de alimentos, etc. Su F. está compuesta por ella, y sus 4 hijos, de los cuales solo uno vive con ella. Vive en la ciudad de Santiago, siendo esta la segunda mas grande del país, cuya economía depende de la agricultura, ganadería y de la producción de tabaco entre otras; también cuenta con una amplia población de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos que viven en comunidades de muy escasos recursos. Le encanta escuchar musica y bailar en sus tiempos libres.

Nieve está muy emocionada de recibir su cuarto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 2 años, el cual inició cuando tomo su primer prestamo. Nieve está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en su negocio, en el cual vende ropas nuevas para todo tipo de cliente. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para arreglar su vivienda y comprar unos muebles que le hacen falta.
texts.en:
Nieve is one of the members of the Renovacion las Aguilas 1, 4 & 5 Group which is formed by 15 micro business people. All members sells clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. 

Nieve's family is formed by herself and four children, only one of which lives with her. She lives in the town of Santiago, the second largest in the country. The town's economy depends on agriculture, cattle raising and tobacco growing, among others. The town also has a large Dominican and Haitian immigrant population who live with very limited resources. They love to listen and dance to music in their free time.

Nieve is very excited to receive her fourth loan with Esperanza Internacional after having duly paid her previous loan and taken the step to grow her business. She has had her business for around 2 years. She started it when she took her first loan. Nieve plans to invest her new loan in her business. She sells new clothes to a varied clientele. She will use her income to renovate her home and to purchase some furniture she still misses.

loans.use: Pants, skirts, shirts, polo shirts

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent O. O. is thirty five years old and married. His wife sells charcoal while Vincent is a blacksmith. He makes items such as cookers and also does pottery and ceramics. They have two children aged twelve years and ten who they hope to educate to university level. His business is in Kitengela, a busy area near a slaughter house. He has been selling his goods to retailers for three years and says that his business is profitable. His main challenge is scarcity of raw materials and competition from other businesses in the area which are similar to his. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. Vincent is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy scrap metal, clay and red ochre to make more items and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes some day to be a market leader in the industry. He describes himself as honest and business oriented.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal, clay, and red ochre

loans.name: Lucia Nyokabi

texts.en: Lucia K. is 42 years old and married to john Kungu who contributes to the family income. She has been making porridge and selling it from one place to another where her clients are.  She has been in the business for a period of two years with a profit of Kshs. 39,700 per month. This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to buy a dairy cow to increase her profit. She hopes to start a restaurant in the future and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal D. (pictured here in FATEN's branch in Gaza) is a 23-year-old man from Gaza City in the Gaza Strip. He is an employee with a good reputation.

Kamal is engaged and will get married soon. Kamal came to FATEN to request a loan to pay for wedding expenses such as the bride's wedding gown and other wedding needs.

loans.use: To pay for wedding expenses

loans.name: Temtsel

texts.en:
Temtsel is 25 years old and lives with his wife and child in the Arhangai province in Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Temtsel operates a animal rawhides trading business in his town. He purchases products from local herders and uses his own car to transport and sell raw materials to local suppliers for a profit. Temtsel started his business in 2009, with the working capital of 500,000 MNT. Within a short period of time, he has established a stable business in his local community and increased his capital to 1,200,000 MNT. 

In 2008, Temtsel purchased a car to transport his products. He is a modest and hardworking man who is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase animal rawhides and increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase animal rawhides

loans.name: Nolatuesha Ene

texts.en:
Nolatuesha Ene T., a 40-year-old widowed mother of seven children, has been farming on her own piece of land for the last ten years. She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her third loan with which she will buy fertilizer and bags of wheat and maize. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

An assiduous woman whois determined to achieve her goals, Nolatuesha dreams of educating her children and expanding her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and bags of wheat and maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchse materials so he can expand his business

loans.name: Luis Manuel Mesias

texts.es:
Luis Manuel Mesias A. Y. tiene 30 años, es casado vive  con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 9 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, café y naranja. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel Mesias A. Y. is 30-years-old. He's married and lives with his wife and 3 children in the Cantón Chillanes in the province of Bolívar.

The members of V.R.C.  JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS are located in the Matilde Esther building in Cantón Chillanes. This communal bank has 9 members who work in agriculture, growing cacao, coffee, and oranges.

Luis grows cacao, coffee, and oranges. He buys his products in Mata de Cacao at the end of every month and sells them at the Sunday fairs in Chillanes.

He's requesting this loan to buy supplies for growing cacao, coffee, and oranges. The support from this loan will help him economically to provide the necessities. He faces challenges such as plagues, illnesses, and varied weather. His dream is to buy a farm.

He likes to work.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for cultivating cacao, coffee, and oranges

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a vegetable stall.  She sells from home to her neighbors. She sells consumable goods on a daily basis, which helps her provide basic needs to her family. Mwanajuma faces a challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, cabbage, kale, and coconuts for sale. She joined Yehu Microfinance to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, cabbage, kale and coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 49 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has 9 children between the ages of 11 and 36. Only four of her children live at home with her, the older ones are independent and the younger ones are still attending school. 

For 11 years Helena has been selling oil and coal. She sells to some of her customers on credit and sometimes it's difficult for her to collect payments. She started the business with money from her husband. She was not able to attend school but thanks to her business her children have gone to school and some are still attending; in addition it has also help build her family's home. 

Helena has requested a loan to purchase more coal and oil. In the future Helena hopes to be doing business internationally and wants to send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy oil and coal

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is currently in the business of selling cassava. She is 23 years old and married with four children, only two of whom go to school. Charity borrowed a loan to stock more cassava to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a better model taxi to attract more loyal customers.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en: Nimfa is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nimfa owns and operates a business buying and selling several kinds of dried fish like pinikas & bariles to the local community. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Nimfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nimfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Nimfa is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish like pinikas and bariles. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Nimfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish like pinikas and bariles

loans.name: Jekadi  A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 femmes du groupe JEKADI A font partie de l’association JEKADI I de KAPALA. Elles sont toutes mariées et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, au moins 4 enfants. KAPALA  de SIKASSO (troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.)  
Elles font la culture du pois de terre et du pois sucré tels  avec TENIN.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a maintenant deux ans.
TENIN compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de pois, des intrants et des équipements appropriés pour sa production et sa récolte. Ces équipements et intrants seront achetés au grand marché de Sikasso. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de la même ville en détail (souvent en gros) à divers clients.
TENIN envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000 à 120 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women from the group called JEKADI A are members of the Association JEKADI I of KAPALA in SIKASSO (third administrative region of Mali). They are all married and live in big traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They are 33 years old on average and have at least four children. 

They grow Bambara and sugar peas, as does TENIN. Wishing to make their agricultural endeavors profitable, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. 

TENIN intends to use her portion of the loan to buy a sufficient quantity of pea seeds, entrants, and appropriate equipment for cultivation and harvest. The equipment and entrants will be purchased at the big open-air market of Sikasso. After the rainy season is over, the harvest is stockpiled for a certain time so that its value increases before it is sold retail (often wholesale) at the big market of the same town to various customers. 

TENIN expects to make an average profit of 80,000 to 120,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and for everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, entrants, and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El comité “Virgen del Rosario", se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora Martina; actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo, con quince (15) integrantes.
Culminaron el primer ciclo sin inconvenientes, han demostrado unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; en el ciclo actual se incorporan dos nuevas integrantes, quienes poseen actividad económica y son muy trabajadoras.
La sra. Martina se dedica a la producción y venta de mandioca, es un producto típico de Paraguay, muy consumido en el país en sustitución del panificado, e incluso es mucho más solicitado que los panes por su sabor y accesibilidad económica.
Ella ha aprovechado estas cualidades para poder hacer crecer su negocio, vendiendo a los almacenes y personas que deseen consumirlo sin necesidad de poseer un negocio.
Martina desea poder aumentar sus ingresos aumentando sus producciones y solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
The club "Virgen del Rosario" was formed at the initiative of Martina. Currently they are in their second cycle and have 15 members.

They finished the first cycle without problems, and have demonstrated unity and solidarity among the members. During the current cycle two new hardworking women with businesses will be incorporated into the group.

Martina grows and sells mandioca [cassava], a product typical to Paraguay and consumed throughout the country in place of bread. It is much more popular than bread because of its flavor and low cost.

She has taken advantage of these qualities to grow her business, selling to the large stores and to people who want to eat it without needing to have a business.

Martina wants to increase her income by increasing her production, and asks for a loan to buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer to increase crop production.

loans.name: Mirali

texts.ru: Мирали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Имеет 10 детей. У них большая и дружная семья. Мирали занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи для продажи. В этой области он работает уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения ядохимикатов, чтобы уничтожить вредных насекомых.
texts.en: Mirali lives in Yavan. He is 36 years old, married, and has ten children. They have a large and loving family. Mirali is a farmer.  He grows vegetables for sale. He has been doing this for eight years. He is taking out a loan to buy insecticide to destroy harmful insects.

loans.use: to buy insecticide.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Babacar du banc villageois de Ngadji est créé depuis le 17 mai 2010. Il est composé de 08 femmes qui s'activent dans le petit commerce de haricots, dans la transformation d'huile et de l'embouche ovine.
La responsable, Awa, âgée de 51 ans, est veuve et mère de 07 enfants. Sur la photo elle est tout à fait à droite habillée en jaune.
Elle fait de l'embouche et du petit commerce. Elle confectionne des petits pagnes et de l'encens. Elle vend aussi du poisson sec. Elle a de l’expérience dans ces domaines.
Elle voudrai acheter des sujets et des marchandises avec son prêt.
Avec ses bénéfices elle gère sa famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Babacar of the Banc Villageois of Ngadji was created on May 17, 2010. It is composed of eight women who are active in small businesses involving beans, the processing of oil, and the fattening of sheep. 

Awa, who is the group's official, is 51 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. In the photo, she is the one at the far right and dressed in yellow. She raises livestock and works in small-scale commerce. She also sells dried fish and incense. She has experience in these domains. 

With her loan, she would like to buy animals and some merchandise. With her profits, she manages her family.

loans.use: to buy animals for raising and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María tiene  47 años de edad, es casada, cuenta con casa propia ,la misma que esta ubicada en el distrito de Catacaos, en el departamento de Piura al norte del Perú, la zona donde vive es rural por tal motivo aun no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

María se dedica a la elaboración, venta de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), esta actividad lo realiza desde hace varios años, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado de generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de la chicha de jora, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer María a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz y algunos utensilios para seguir elaborando su rica chicha de jora, con la finalidad de que su producto siga siendo el mejor y así sus clientes aumenten, para obtener mejores ganancias y solventar todas las necesidades del hogar.

María tiene muy buenas referencias, pues las personas que la conocen la describen como un apersona, responsable y trabajadora, con muy buen carácter
texts.en:
María, 47, is married and lives in her own house in the district of Catacaos, in the department of Piura in northern Perú.  She lives in a rural area that does not have basic utilities.

María makes and sells "chicha de jora" (a tasty drink made from corn which is very popular in northern Perú).  She has been in business for several years since this is a a tradition that is passed from generation to generation.  Recently chicha de jora sales have increased, thus increasing income and quality of life for her family.

In view of the opportunity to expand, María has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 PEN to buy more corn and some utensils to continue making chicha de jora.  Her aim is to have the best product to attract more customers.  This way she will obtain better profits and be able to cover her household expenses.

María has very good references and people describe her as being responsible and hard-working, with a nice personality.

loans.use: To buy corn and utensils to continue making "chicha de jora" drink.

loans.name: Edda Del Socorro

texts.es: Edda Del Socorro tiene su negocio que es la venta de articulos escolares, hace mas de 14 años que tiene este negocio. ella es una mujer emprendedora y resposnble que quiere salir adelante con su familia. su negocio esta ubicado contiguo al centro de salud. el credito que solicita es para la compra de cuadernos, cartulinas, lapiceros, borradores, reglas y hojas. desea que su negocio crezca para seguir proporcionando a su familia el alimento diario.
texts.en: Edda Del Socorro sells school supplies.  She’s been in business over 14 years.  She is an enterprising, responsible woman who wants to get ahead with her family.  Her business is located next door to the health center.  The loan she’s asking for is to buy notebooks, construction paper, mechanical pencils, erasers, rulers and sheets of paper.  She wants her business to grow to continue providing her family with their daily food.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, construction paper, mechanical pencils, erasers, rulers and sheets of paper.

loans.name: Zaddock

texts.en:
Zaddock is a married man with one son who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past four years, he has operated a hardware business, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Zaddock dreams of becoming a leading supplier of timber in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase timber for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 31-year-old woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. Her husband works in a blacksmith workshop with a modest income. Sahar has her own project, a grocery store, to help her husband cover life expenses. She wants to improve the grocery store situation by purchasing bulk quantities of groceries, but she hasn't enough money to pay so she needs to take out a loan of  $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Sahar takes out the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will pay to improve her grocery store and sell more to increase the family income and have better life conditions. Sahar is photographed in her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase bulk amounts of groceries.

loans.name: Los Helechos Group

texts.es:
La señora Alicia, vive en un lugar bonito, ella es  casada  con el señor  Donaciano  y con quien procreo  ocho  hijos de los cuales  cuatro  ya están casado y  cuatro están a su  responsabilidad.

    Ella solicito   el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra de   marranos para engordarlo y después venderlo  en la misma localidad, en esta actividad lleva practicando  cinco  años y ocho meses en la que comenta que le va bien  ya que con ellos a  mejorado sus ingresos para su  hogar.
 
    Su inspiración por esta actividad  fue para apoyar a  su esposo con los ingresos de la casa  y así  sacar adelante a sus hijos que están  con ella, aun así también su esposo trabaja en el campo y vende naranja cuando es la temporada.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda seguir trabajando para   que cada día mejore más  sus ingresos y así sacar delante a su familia.

     Las personas que integran en el grupo son: el señor Tomas  quien invertirá el préstamo  en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de block y así también se integra la señora María Ruth quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra  de fierros viejos y luego los venderá por kilo.
texts.en:
Señora Alicia lives in a pretty area.  She is married to Señor  Donaciano, with whom she has eight children.  Four of them are married, and the other four are still her responsibility.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of pigs to fatten and later sell in the same location.  She has been practicing this activity for five years and eight months, and comments that it's going very well for her, as it has improved her household income.

Her inspiration for this activity was to be able to help her husband with household income, and so be able to help those children who remain at home to move ahead in life.  Her husband works in the fields and sells oranges when they are in season.

What she most desires is to continue working in this small business.  With each day that passes, her income improves and so she can move her family ahead in life.

The other people who make up this group are: Señor Tomas, who will invest his loan in purchasing materials for making cinder-blocks, and also Señora María Ruth who will invest her loan in the purchase of old iron which she will later sell by the kilo.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of small pigs to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth, tiene la edad de 40 años, es casado pero está separada de su esposo y tiene tres hijas que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere  comprar pollos de engorde para mejorar la producción y aumentar las ventas. Tiene varios años que se dedica a ésta actividad y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  ha realizado otros préstamos en Cooperativa de crédito, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Yaneth también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijas la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro unas personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 40 years old and married, but is separated from her husband. She has three daughters who are her highest priority. Yaneth want to buy chickens for fattening so that she can improve production and increase her sales. She has been in this business for several years and wants to grow.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has received other loans from a credit cooperative, but FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate. Yaneth also wants to provide her daughters with the necessary education so that they can be prepared individuals in the future and have an easier time facing life.

loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening.

loans.name: Lavinah

texts.en:
Lavinah is a 25-year-old married woman with three children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has a number of businesses, including retail, hardware, and drug shops. She has run these businesses for three years. Her hardship is bad debtors. Her vision is to have a well-established businesses and a well-educated, wealthy family.

Lavinah needs this loan to buy toothbrushes, bread, and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy toothbrushes, bread, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson 39 years old, a father of four children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been a farmer for five years.  He started with half an acre of land, and now has four acres of land. Johnson both farms and sells bananas and coffee. His hardship is insufficient capital, and his vision is to have a modern commercial farm and to educate his family. Johnson is requesting a loan to enable him buy coffee and bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy coffee and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Essowédewou

texts.fr:
Essowédewou est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et est mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé de la famille a 25 ans et le benjamin 17 ans.  
Essowédewou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2001. Elle achète et revend du charbon de bois et du maïs à toutes personnes à son domicile. Elle s’approvisionne régulièrement dans les villages de l’intérieur du pays, et travaille seule. 
Essowédewou a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon et de maïs destinés à la vente. Elle prévoit réinvestir les profits supplémentaires de son activité dans la diversification des marchandises. 
Dans les prochaines années, Essowédewou voudrait aussi du haricot et des ignames. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit acheter une moto pour les déplacements de ces enfants.
texts.en:
Essowédewou, age 39, is married to a driver and the mother of three school-attending children. The eldest is 25 years old, and the youngest is 17.

Essowédewou has been a reseller since 2001. She buys charcoal and corn, and resells them to a diverse clientele at her home.

She gets her supplies on a regular basis from villages in the interior of the country, and works on her own.

She's seeking her third loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy sacks of charcoal and corn to resell. 

She intends to reinvest the additional profits in her business, in order to diversify her products.

In the forthcoming years, Essowédewou would like to offer beans and yams as well. 

She says that she will use her profits to buy a motorcycle to transport her children.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and corn to resell

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: Marvin, tiene la edad  de 52 años, está en casado y vive solo actualmente. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia del maíz sembrado. El cuenta con la propiedad a su poder ya sembrada y necesita abonarla para poder generar más cosecha este próximo año. El quiere generar más cosecha que la del año anterior para poder generar mayores ganancias que el año anterior. El tiene como meta prioritaria generar las mejores ganancias económicas para salir con los pagos del crédito y estabilizara su nivel económico mejor para poder gozar de un mejor bienestar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marvin, age 52, is married and he currently lives alone.

He will use the loan to buy supplies to help his corn crop.  He has a piece of property that is already seeded, and he needs to fertilize it to be able to generate more harvest this coming year.  He wants to generate more harvest than last year in order to generate more income than last year.

His priority goal is to generate better income in order to repay the loan and better stabilize his standard of living better.  He wants to do this in order to be able to enjoy improved well-being. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other previous loans in state banks.  FUDECOSUR provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to help his corn crop.

loans.name: Yart

texts.en:
Yart, 59, is married and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Yart is a housewife and her husband is a construction worker. 

Yart is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease the expenses for public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Tuhfa

texts.ru: Тухфа  сотрудничает с нашей организацией  более 7 лет. Первый кредит получала на ларек возле своего дома. Сейчас она имеет 2 точки продажи женского материала и одежды. Живет одна, муж уехал на заработки 15 лет назад и не вернулся. В бизнесе помогает внучка. Кроме это, того она работает в Университете преподавателем истории. В дни, когда она на работе в университете, внучка сидит и приглядывает за товаром, так она помогает своей бабушке. Тухфа сама за товаром ездить не может из-за здоровья и возраста, ей привозят товар знакомые или родственники.  Товар привозят с Киргизии в течении 4-5 дней.  На полученный кредит она собирается привезти теплую одежду - джемпера, халаты, а из тканей велюр, бархат и другие модные национальные ткани. Сейчас у нее сезон, так как перед новым годом будет хорошая реализация, женщины буду шить на праздники красивые платья.
texts.en: Tuhfa has been working with our organization for over seven years.  She received her first loan for a retail stand near her house.  Now, she has two retail outlets, where she sells women's fabrics and clothing.  She lives alone because her husband left for work 15 years ago and never returned.  Her granddaughter helps her with the business.  Besides this, Tuhfa works as a history teacher at the University.  During the days, when she works at the university, her granddaughter helps her grandmother.  Tuhfa cannot travel for merchandise herself due to her health and age, and her friends or relatives deliver merchandise to her.  They bring merchandise from Kyrgyzstan in 4-5 days.  Tuhfa plans to bring in warm clothing, such as sweaters and robes, and fabrics, such as velour, velvet and other stylish national fabrics.  Currently, this is a prime season for her business because sales will be good before the New Year's, since women will be sewing nice dresses for the holidays.

loans.use: to purchase warm clothing and fabrics

loans.name: Huexca Santa Cruz Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Huexca Santa Cruz está conformado por las señoras Alicia, Maricela, Eliza van a comprar con su crédito borregos para crianza, la señora Gloria va a comprar pulseras y anillos de oro, el señor Rodolfo va a comprar becerros, la señora Socorro va a comprar leche para preparar queso y crema, la señora Alejandra va a comprar huevo, leche y refrescos, la señora Roció va a comprar fertilizantes, la señora María del Socorro va a comprar maíz, carnes, jitomate, tomates, cebolla, chiles para preparar tlacoyos y tortas. La señora Maricela tiene 40 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos 2 varones y 1 mujer, los dos más pequeños están estudiando la secundaria, ella vende borregos, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar sorgo, maíz, milpa para alimentar a sus borregos, ella inicio su negocio hace 8 años su esposo la animo en este negocio lo iniciaron con lo que le dieron de la venta del sorgo, en esta comunidad la mayoría se dedican a la ganadería, los borregos los tiene en el campo, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para la comida, para volver a invertir, de ahí toma los borregos para la fiestas de sus hijos, a ella le gusta ver que los borregos van creciendo y se siente orgullosa ver que sus hijos le ayudan en la crianza van en la tarde a pastorear los borregos. Sus sueños y esperanzas que su negocio siga creciendo, construir un cuartito para recamara de su hija y que sus hijos más pequeños sigan estudiando. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por sus préstamos, por confiar en nosotros, vamos a cumpliren los pagos y esperamos que nos sigan apoyando con sus prestamos".
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Huexca Santa Cruz and is made up of members Alicia, Maricela and Eliza who are going to buy sheep to breed; Gloria who is going to buy bracelets and gold rings; Rodolfo who is going to buy calves; Secorro who is going to buy milk to use making cheese and cream; Alejandra who is going to buy eggs, milk and soft drinks; Roció who is going to buy fertilizer; María del Socorro who is going to buy corn, meat, tomatoes, onions, chiles to make tlacoyos (similar to tortillas) and sandwiches.

Maricela is 40 years old. She is married and has 3 children, 2 sons and 1 daughter. The two youngest are high school students. She sells sheep and is asking for a loan in order to buy sorghum and corn and corn-feed in order to nourish the sheep. She began her business 8 years ago, encouraged by her husband, beginning with the profit from the sell of sorghum. 

Most people in this community work as livestock farmers, having sheep in the fields. The business is important because it provides income for food, to reinvest, and for parties for the children. She likes to see the sheep grow and she feels proud to see her children helping to nurture the sheep and putting them out to pasture in the afternoon.

Her hopes and dreams are that her business continues growing, and to build a little room as a bedroom for her daughter, and that her youngest children continue studying. 

The members of the group send this message to Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “thank them for the loans, for their confidence in us, and say that we will make the payments and we hope that they continue supporting us through our loans.”

loans.use: to buy sorghum and corn and corn-feed in order to nourish the sheep

loans.name: Ajelina

texts.en:
Ajelina is a 40 year old married woman with eight children all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in kator south Sudan for six years.
Ajelina is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase charcoal. she will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
