Rena provides "motorela" or motorcycle transport services, with her husband working as the driver. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Rena is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil is 27 years old single farmer who lives in the Salyan region, Yenikand village. She has been in this business for 4 years.
Having borrowed $300, she bought a 0.1 hectare plot of land.
Now she needs a loan of $600 to buy 8 pregnant sheep in order to start sheep-breeding.
She earns her income from this business. This has enabled her to cover most of her household expenses.

loans.use: To buy 8 pregnant sheep to start sheep-breeding

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson has a microenterprise dedicated to the distribution of books. He is 40 years old and has 3 children. His wife helps him in the running of his business. He has four employees, who are responsible for marketing, product distribution, and their respective receipts. Anderson has over 10 years of experience in this field. With this business, he generates many jobs both directly and indirectly.

He has been a client of IMPRO since 2004. His history with our organization has qualified him as a #1 client, which is to say that he has complied very well with the repayment of his obligation. The loan he is requesting here will be used to buy books. His work experience makes him confident that with this credit he will obtain an income that will enable him to repay the loan.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Business Description

Lili has 4 years of experience with this business. She started out selling items of clothing. Little by little she saved her money, and together with her sister decided to buy a cart for selling fast food. She came up with the idea on her own initiative, and she liked it. She works only on the weekends, from 5 p.m. until 11 p.m. She keeps her cart at her father's house, which has made it easier for her to run her business.

Loan Use

Lili wants this loan to buy supplies wholesale, which will make her work easier and she won't have to go out to buy her products. Also she would like to remodel her cart. This will help her provide better service to her customers. She would also like to start selling soft drinks and juices.

Personal Information

Lili is a single mother. She is 26 years old and has 2 children, who are both in school and are her reason for living. She has succeeded, thanks to her effort, in giving them the things they need. She has her own little house, which she is completing little by little. She hopes with this investment to improve her income and the life of her family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Lili tiene una experiencia de 4 años con su negocio. Se inicio vendiendo prendas de vestir. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y son ayuda de su hermana deciden comprarse una carreta para la venta de comida rápida. Fue por iniciativa propia que le agrado la idea. Trabaja solo los fines de semana en horario de 5 p.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Ella tiene su carreta en la casa de su papa. El cual le ha dado la facilidad para que ella monte su negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

Lili desea el crédito para comprar víveres al por mayor. Lo que ha ella le facilitaría el trabajo y no tendría que estar saliendo a comprar sus productos. Además desea un poco remodelar su carreta. De esta manera darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Desea también vender colas y jugos.

Información Personal

Lili es madre soltera. Tiene 26 años y dos hijos. Los que estudian y son la razón de su vida. Ella ha logrado gracias a su esfuerzo poder darle lo que ellos necesitan. Tiene una casita propia la cual poco a poco esta logrando terminarla de construir. Esperando con la inversión que realizara mejorar sus ingresos y la vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy groceries wholesale

loans.name: Ilsem

texts.es:
Ilsem D. Conde has a one year old child. She sells cosmetics at the Lanza's Market in the city of La Paz.Two years ago, for different reasons, mainly economical, she had no choice but to rent her selling spot to her aunt - who currently collaborates with her nephews.

Ilsem needs money to be able to own her own business and start selling cosmetics with more will and power - since his son has more and more needs to be satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ilsem D. Conde Madre de 1 hijo, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en el Mercado Lanza de la ciudad de La Paz. Por diferentes motivos, principalmente económicas se vio obligada a dar en alquiler el puesto de venta a su tía, la cual hace dos años administra y colabora a sus sobrinos.. Ilsem precisa de dinero para poder tener su negocio y emprender con mas fuerza la venta de cosméticos, en vista de que su hijo cada vez tiene más necesidades que deben ser satisfechas.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema R. is a 31-year-old mother of three and a resident of Tandiika in Dar es Salaam. She runs a small restaurant and sells used clothes, a business she has been doing for the past 3 years. She wants to expand her restaurant to a full-time operation and will need to buy more chairs and tables, and improve other facilities with time. Neema would like a loan of $250 to help her achieve this goal.

loans.use: To increase her restaurant's hours of operation to full time and upgrade its interior

loans.name: Leonila

texts.es:
Señora Leonila belongs to the Mientras Tanto Group “Las Florcitas D. Progreso” and lives at Jr. Tacna Nº 135 in the San Martín region of San Martín, Tarapoto. Her business is located at Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 1130 (Paradero de Combis). She sells traditional foods like juanes, tamalitos and humitas and rents rooms in her house. At home, her mother helps her make the juanes, and thanks to the support from Manuela Ramos and the loans, she feels confident about taking on the high season for sales since she can buy bagged rice, utensils (plates, spoons, cups) and keep her clientele satisfied. With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos of S/. 500.00 ($ 167.00), which she will pay off in 4 months, she bought 3 bags of rice, plates, spoons and cups, and is also doing some repairs in the rooms she rents out. Señora Leonila is 56 years old. She is very pleased with her work since she only sells during the morning and can take care of her mother during the afternoon. She is an example of a woman that has always gotten ahead on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Leonila pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Florcitas D. Progreso”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, con domicilio en el Jr. Tacna Nº 135. Su actividad económica la realiza en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 1130 (Paradero de Combis), se dedica a la venta de juanes, tamalitos y humitas, asimismo alquila cuartos al interior de su casa. En casa, le ayuda su mamá en la elaboración de los juanes, y gracias al apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos, por medio de los préstamos, se siente segura para afrontar la temporada alta en la venta ya que puede comprar el arroz en sacos, los utensilios (platos, cucharas, vasos) y satisfacer a su clientela. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 ($ 167.00) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró 3 sacos de arroz, platos, cucharas y vasos, así también está realizando algunos arreglos en los cuartos que alquila. La señora Leonila, tiene 56 años, se siente muy contenta con la actividad que realiza ya que sólo vende por las mañanas y en las tardes le permite dedicarse a su mamá. Ella es un ejemplo de mujer que siempre ha salido adelante sola.

loans.use:
Purchase ingredients. Upkeep the rooms for rent.

Compra de insumos. Mantenimiento de habitaciones en alquiler.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida is 53 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children, both now happily married for a couple years. She says that in spite of the problems that she had while raising her children she was able to give them the best and enable them to be successful professionals today.

Nelida has had a mini-market in her home for over 15 years, where she and her partner work. This business is one of her best accomplishments as all her life she has dreamed of owning her own business.

The loan she asks for is to purchase merchandise for her business such as flour, milk, eggs, fruit, vegetables, meat, canned goods and soda pop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nelida tiene 53 años, vive en pareja y tiene 2 hijos, ambos ya felizmente casados hace un par de años. Cuenta que a pesar de los problemas que se le presentaban a medida que iban creciendo sus hijos ella de igual manera pudo darle lo mejor a ellos y hacer que hoy día ya sean profesionales.

La señora tiene un mini mercado en su domicilio propio, ella se dedica a este tipo de actividad hace más de 15 años, que hoy en día es atendido por ella y su pareja. Este negocio es uno de sus mejores logros ya que toda su vida soñó con contar con su negocio propio.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de mercaderías para su negocio como harina, leche, huevos, frutas, verduras, carne, productos enlatados y gaseosas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business such as flour, milk, eggs, fruit, vegetables, meat, canned goods, and soda pop.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
For seven years, in the city of León in the Central market, Maria Q. has worked selling clothing of all sizes and for all ages. In the market, she now has her own section, which was a big investment. She has also been able to supply her business with a larger amount of clothing. Having her own section and more clothing to sell, allow her to better support her two small children.

She started the business 7 years ago, selling clothes by walking around the market, exposing herself to the sun and wearing down her body because of walking so much. Little by little she began to save money until she eventually was able to purchase an inside spot in the market.

Since she was able to obtain this section in the market three years ago, she has had 12 loans with Ceprodel which have had a big impact for her - she has bought larger quantities of clothing to sell in addition to being able to sustain the nucleus of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 7 años en la ciudad de León en el mercado Central, la señora Maria Q. se dedica a la venta de ropa de todos tamaños y para todas las edades. Posee un tramo propio el cual le ha costado mucha inversión y por ser madre de dos hijos pequeños a que mantener ha logrado surtir de mayores cantidades de ropa su negocio.

El negocio lo comienza hace 7 años vendiendo ambulante en todo el mercado, exponiéndose al sol y al desgaste físico de producidos por el caminar mucho. Poco a poco comenzó a invertir para pagar un local interno en el mercado hasta que lo obtuvo.

Desde que logro obtener el tramo en el mercado hace tres años, ha realizado 12 créditos en Ceprodel que le han impactado grandemente por el hecho de que ha comprado mayores volúmenes de ropa para ofrecer y además ha podido sostener el núcleo de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase clothing.

loans.name: Dédé Kafui

texts.fr:
Born in Lomé on January 26, 1949, Mrs. Dédé Kafui E. is married and responsible for 5 persons. She is retired but has taken up selling clothing and cosmetics. In order to expand her little business, she is asking for a loan that will allow her to purchase fashionable clothing, handbags, shoes, and cosmetics to sell so that she will be able to attact more customers. This business expansion will allow her to increase her income so as to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Lomé le 26 Janvier 1949, Madame E. Dédé Kafui est mariée et a à sa charge cinq (5) personnes. Retraitée, son activité est axée sur la vente des produits vestimentaires et cosmétiques. Pour augmenter la taille de son activité, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en nouveauté d’habits, sacs et chaussures et des produits cosmétiques afin d’attirer plus de clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus pour un mieux être de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchasing clothes, handbags, shoes, and cosmetics for resale in her boutique

Approvisionnement de sa boutique en habits, sacs, chaussures et produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
Edson sells cellular phones at the 12 de Octubre zone market in the city of El Alto. This is his primary source of income with which he supports himself and covers his university expenses. He is currently studying law at the Universidad Publica El Alto (UPEA). He lives in the Los Villa Tunari zone in the city of El Alto.

He needs this loan in order to purchase more cellular phones, thus allowing him to increase his earnings and pay for his studies.

This is Edson’s second loan with Impro. His credit history allows him to be approved for this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Edson es comerciante de celulares, los mismos que comercializa en la feria de la zona 12 de octubre de la ciudad de El Alto, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con la que se mantiene y cubre sus estudios universitarios en la Universidad Publica El Alto UPEA de la Carrera de Derecho; vive en la Zona Los Villa Tunari de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para aumentar su mercadería de celulares e incrementar sus ingresos y cubrir sus estudios.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Purchase of more cellular phones for his business

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou S. is married and has been a member of the village bank Niaguiss Nema in Ziguinchor for four years. She would like to buy merchandise such as oil, rice, sugar, milk, tea and coffee to stock her store she runs with her husband. The profits will help her to satisfy the needs of her family. She is asking for a loan that will be repaid at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Aissatou S., mariée est membre du banc villageois de Niaguiss Néma à Ziguinchor depuis 4ans. Elle veut acheter de la marchandise comme de l’huile, du riz, du sucre, du lait, du thé, et du café pour renforcer sa boutique qu’elle gère avec l’aide de son mari. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer à la satisfaction des besoins de la famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To stock her store with rice, sugar, milk, coffee, and tea

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta recently became a mother and this immense happiness gave her the opportunity to open a small shop in her house so she could contribute to her family and, of course, to the well-being of her little one. The popularity of this small space has been increasing day-by-day, and for this reason, she wishes to improve it by purchasing a greater quantity of stock so she may satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Berta, recientemente se ha convertido en madre y esa inmensa alegría le ha dado la posibilidad también de aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa para contribuir con los suyos y por supuesto para generarle bienestar a su pequeño.La popularidad de este pequeño espacio se ha ido incrementando día a día y por esta razón desea mejorar su administración con la compra de mayor cantidad de artículos de primera necesidad para la satisfacción plena de sus clientes.

loans.use: An increase in capital so she may expand her product mix.

loans.name: Kokouvi Messanvi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokouvi Messanvi F., born in 1958 in Attitogon, has been retailing honey and corn in Bé-Kpota since 2004. He is married to Ablavi Akakpo and they have four children. His honey-selling business is going really well because his customers have confidance in the quality of his product.

He has already received a loan from WAGES and paid it back appropriately.

This second loan that he is requesting will allow him to purchase 5 tins of honey and 5 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Revendeur de miel et de maïs, monsieur F. Kokouvi Menssanvi, né en 1958 à Attitogon, exerce son activité à Bé-Kpota à Lomé depuis 2004. Il est marié à AKAKPO Ablavi et ils ont quatre enfants. Cette activité de vente de miel marche très bien pour lui car ses clients ont la confiance en la qualité de son produit.

Il a une fois béneficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé.

Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 bidons de miel et 5 sacs de maïs.

loans.use:
Purchase of honey and corn

Achat de miel et de maïs

loans.name: Cheikh Sadibou

texts.fr:
This young entrepreneur is involved in services (photocopies, word-processing). He is requesting this loan to boost his business by developing bookbinding and to stock reams of paper more cheaply for wholesale purchases. Situated across from the ACAPES School, his clientele consists of students and teachers, not to mention economic operators.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

Ce jeune entrepreneur intervient dans les services (photocopies, tritement de texte). Il demande ce srédit pour renforcer ses activités en développant la reliure et stocker des rames de papiers à moindre pour les achats en gros. Situé en face du Groupe Scolaire ACAPES, il a une clientéle constituée d'éléves et d'enseignants sans compter les opérateurs économiques.

loans.use: Boost business

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal  Mujeres Creativas II, ubicado en el Jr. Manantay Mz.5 Lt.21del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es estibador. Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de comida.

Rosa, en la actualidad continúa con su venta de comida y golosinas, ella vende  todas las tardes su comida y golosinas  junto a la plaza del reloj público, en la cual   ella recibe el apoyo de sus 2 hijas y una nieta.

 Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará utensilios de cocina y golosinas.

Rosa, esta muy contenta de pertenecer a un banquito comunal y aprecia la compañía de las socias que gracias  a ello su negocio esta surgiendo. Y tiene  toda la esperanza de seguir surgiendo para así poder dar educación  a sus hijas y nieta.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Community Bank Mujeres Creativas II, located at Jr. Manantay Mz.5 Lt.21, in the Calleria District, Department of Ucayali. She is a 58-year-old mother of 5 children. Her husband is a longshoreman. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos in the amount of 300 sols, Rosa decided to invest in selling food. Right now Rosa continues to sell food and candy every afternoon next to the square with the town's clock tower. She gets help from her 2 daughters and a granddaughter. , With this loan of 1,000 sols, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy kitchen utensils and candy. Rosa is very happy to be a part of a community bank, and she appreciates the company of her partners. Thanks to all of this, her business is thriving. She is very hopeful that it will continue to prosper so that she can afford an education for her daughters and granddaughter.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies. To buy candy.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata D. est mariée et agée de trente huit ans. Elle vend des vetements pour enfants des chaussures des patalons en djin pour adultes dans son quartier à Cité Lamy depuis un an
texts.en:
Aminata D. is married and is thrity-eight years old. For the last year she has been selling children's clothing and shoes as well as pants for adults from her home in the city of Lamy.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of various articles

loans.name: Bertha Flor

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Flor P. T. pertenece al  banco comunal JERID Camino al Éxito, tiene 43 años y vive en la Avenida La Marina manzana 1 lote 23 del pueblo joven Aurora Díaz del distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio Secundaria completa, pero ya no continuo con estudios superiores debido a que se casó con César Antonio Briseño Sánchez con quien tiene 4 hijos  de los cuales 2 dependen de ella.
Empezó su negocio haciendo mazamorra, arroz con leche, queque y empanadas, luego se percató que en la época de invierno tiene mayor salida las papas rellenas, ella sola no podía hacer la gran demanda que tenia por lo que se asoció con Rossy Paola y  ahora venden juntas papa rellena y otros productos que se venden rápidamente.
El negocio es en Andrés Tello manzana 1 lote 7. Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas y quiso cambiar de negocio, compró ropa interior pero no fue satisfactoria la venta así que con sus otros préstamos restituyo la perdida.
Con este crédito de 800 que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa invertir en el negocio, comprará insumos para así poder incrementarlo.
Bertha sueña con tener una gran ferretería donde pueda abastecer de material de construcción de botes a todos los pescadores de la zona.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha Flor P. T. is a member of the JERID Camino al Éxito (Road to Success) microfinance institute. She is 43 years of age and lives on La Marina Avenue, block 1, lot 23 in the town of Joven Aurora Díaz, in the Salaverry district of the Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad Perú. She completed high school, but did not continue on to higher education because she married César Antonio Briseño Sánchez, with whom she has 4 children—two are still her dependants. She started out making mazamorra—pudding made with corn starch, sugar and honey—rice pudding, pancakes, and empanadas. Then she noticed that the winter season was optimum for selling stuffed potatoes. She could not meet the high demand, so she partnered up with Rossy Paola, and together they now sell stuffed potatoes and other products that sell quickly. The business is located on Andrés Tello, block 1, lot 7. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which were repaid in 4 monthly installments. She wanted to change her business, so she purchased undergarments to sell, but her sales were unsatisfactory. As a result, she made up for the losses with her next loans. She plans on investing this 800.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, in the business by purchasing supplies in order to expand. Bertha dreams of having a large hardware store that she can fill with boat construction materials for the fishermen in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Solteritas ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry Nº. 754, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 39 años D. edad, es madre soltera D. un hijo menor D. edad que aún depenD. D. ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. abarrotes. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa. Se dedica al cuidado D. su pequeño hijo y a la administración D. su negocio.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará un saco D. arroz, un saco D. azúcar, 2 cajas D. leche, 4 paquetes D. gaseosas, variedades D. golosinas, detergentes, etc.

Elizabeth se siente feliz porque su negocio ha crecido y porque tendrá la oportunidad D. darle una buena educación a su hijo para tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the communal bank “Las Solteritas” (“The Single Women”) located at #754 Salaverry Street in the Callería district, Colonel Portillo province, Ucayali. She is 39 years old and the single mother of a young son who still depends on her. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos she decided to invest in the sale of groceries. She has been working with the communal bank for four years.

Currently, she has a store in her house. She dedicates herself to caring for her small son and to administering her business.

With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, to be repaid in five months, she will purchase a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, two boxes of milk, 4 packets of sodas, a variety of candy, detergents, etc.

Elizabeth feels content because her business has grown and because she will have the opportunity to educate her child so he will have a better future.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, two boxes of milk, 4 packets of sodas, a variety of candy, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Babyline

texts.en:
Babyline D. is a young mother; she is 20 years old. Despite her young age, she is very responsible and she uses every resource she can think of in order to solve life’s difficulties. Babyline is married to Romel D.. Romel drives a passenger tricycle to help her support the family's basic needs. Now, with their first born Nathaniel, who is just one year old, they need to try harder to improve their life. The family lives in a mountainous area where most people plant crops.

Babyline manages a small store in their village. She earns PHP 800 each week. She wants to improve her business so that the family can have a better source of daily income. She has promised herself that she will save for the future so they can care for their child in an emergency.

Babyline has not stopped looking for creative ways to develop her business. She perseveres for her family. Therefore, she is requesting PHP 6,000 to help grow her business so that she can realize her family's dreams.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Saomalie

texts.en: Saomalie F., 33, is married with 2 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the sales business. She sells to the village people and public 7 days per week. She is a new member and this is her first loan. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala.  SPBD loans are Saomalie’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase more goods for her shop and a freezer  to maintain business improvement

loans.name: Emma Rita

texts.es:
Enma es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Enma es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Enma viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, que luego de acopiar los procesa en un molino alquilado, elabora harinas, cereales partidos y los vende a las diferentes instituciones y también en los mercados.
Enma necesita un préstamo de 2550 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, haba.
Enma sueña con tener su propias maquinas procesadoras, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos en colegios particulares.
texts.en:
Emma is a member of the Tulipanes Community Bank.

Emma is married common-law, she is 37 years old and she has 2 children. Enma travels to the different town fairs in the region where she purchases cereals, that soon after she acquires them she grinds them in a rented mill, producing flours and crushed cereals. She then sells them to different companies and in the markets.

Emma requires a loan in the amount of 2550 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchse of wheat, grains, and fava beans.

Emma dreams of having her own processing equipment, as well as providing her children with an education in private schools.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wheat, grains, and fava beans.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate A. is married and has 6 dependents. She has received schooling through primary level. Kate sells cooked food at Tatermu near Elmina, which she started not too long ago. Her husband is a commercial driver. Kate uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Kate will use the loan to enable her buy more ingredients to increase the sale of the food she prepares. With the new profits from her expanded business, Kate plans to invest in the children's education.

loans.use: Buy more ingredients

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en: Hoeun S., 25, sells fruit in the local market in Kampong Cham province. She earns about $5 per day, while her husband, who is a a taxi-driver, earns $10 a day. This couple has two young children. Her husband usually gets her grocery items in bulk from the countryside. Mrs. Hoeun S. is seeking a loan to make two investments: to buy more groceries to sell and to built her own fruit store.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Inés

texts.es: Inés tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la compra y venta de animales. Su dinámica de trabajo consiste en comprar los animales los días sábados muy temprano (madrugada) luego los vende en la feria ganadera, generalmente lo que le sobra son cuyes, los que almacena en su granja, los demás animales los deja en casa de su suegra para no gastar en transporte, porque el lugar donde vende está ubicado en otra provincia de su localidad y de considerable distancia. Este negocio le ha permitido tener más ingresos para su familia, ya que su esposo, por su parte, trabaja lejos de la ciudad y muchas veces su sueldo no abastece por completo las necesidades de su casa. Ahora Inés tiene muchos planes de seguir trabajando y comprase un terreno cercano al punto de sus ventas donde pueda guardar a sus animales. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de formar parte de este banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser una integrante participe, activa y colaboradora de su grupo. La cantidad que está solicitando la invertirá en la compra de animales como ovejas, cerdos y cuyes, con los cuales aumentará sus ventas.
texts.en:
Inés is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 children in her parents’ house. For 2 years she has been buying and selling animals. Her work consists of going very early (at dawn) on Saturdays to buy the animals. She then sells them at the livestock fair. Generally the guinea pigs are left, and she keeps them on her farm. The place where she sells is in another province which is very far, so she leaves the rest of the animals at her mother-in-law’s to save having to transport them. This business has given her more income for her family. Her husband works far from the city, and many times his salary does not completely cover the household expenses. Inés plans to keep working. She also plans to buy a piece of land near her selling location where she can keep and sell her animals. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to be a part of this community bank. She promises to participate and be an active collaborator in her group. She will use the loan to buy animals like sheep, pigs and guinea pigs. This will increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number of animals she sells

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Funmilayo sells bottles of drinks and wine. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more bottles of drinks and wine to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bottles of drinks and wine to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro y la señora Lorena son una familia emprendedora e independientes comerciantes.
Se dedican a la elaboración de tortillas de harina para su venta en mayoreo y menudeo, desde hace 6 años, pero también obtiene otros ingresos mediante la tiendita de abarrotes que tienen de nombre “M Y M” desde hace 1 año. Ellos desean ampliarse en el mercado por ello solicitan este crédito para así invertir en mayor mercancía para su venta.
texts.en:
Pedro and Lorena are an enterprising family and are independent merchants. They have dedicated themselves to making flour tortillas to sell at wholesale and retail prices for 6 years. However, they also make income by the means of the little grocery store named “M Y M” that they have had for 1 year. Pedro and Lorena would like to expand in the market. For this reason, they are requesting this loan so that they can invest in more merchandise to be sold.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand their business

loans.name: 15 De Abril Group

texts.es:
El comité 15 de abril nace hace poco mas de dos semanas gracias a la gestión y unión de varias vecinas que ya estuvieron trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya y cuyos comités terminaron hace un tiempo.  Las mujeres decidieron empezar de nuevo, en base a la experiencia adquirida. 

Este comité es de la zona de Paì Ñu, y las integrantes son: 

Liz O..	Peluquería.
Myrian F..	    Venta de Ropas.
Angelica M.. 	Venta de panes.
Irene V.. 	Kiosko.
Migdonia A.. 	Kiosko.
Amanda C.. 	Venta de Verduras.
Blanca G.. 	Macatera.
Belen Saldivar. 	Venta de ropas.
Isabel I..	Venta de perfumes.
Ramona R..	Costura.
Milka G.. 	Venta de ropas.
Daniela A.. 	Venta de perfumes.
Angelica M..	Venta de empanadas.
Ana G..  	Venta de minicargas.
Gladys S.. 	Venta de remedios herbales.
texts.en:
The April 15 committee was created a little over two weeks ago thanks to the cooperation and management from various neighbors who had been working with the Fundación Paraguaya in the past, but whose committees ended some time ago. The women decided to start again, based on experience they had gained. This committee is in the area of Pai nu, and the members are: Liz O.. Barber. Myrian F.. Sale of clothing. Angelica M.. Sale of bread. Irene V.. Kiosko. Migdonia A.. Kiosko. Amanda C.. Sale of vegetables. Blanca G.. Flowerpots. Belen Saldivar. Selling clothes. Isabel I.. Sale of perfumes. Ramona Rolón. Sewing. Milka G.. Selling clothes. Daniela A.. Sale of perfumes. Angelica M.. Selling empanadas. Ana G.. Selling "minicargas". Gladys S.. Sales of herbal remedies.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The sale of the following is done both at home and in the surrounding neighborhoods: Buying shoes, slippers, sandals, buying hair dyes, purchase of soaps, perfumes, buying sugar, pasta, meat, beverages, oil , flour, buying clothes for ladies and gentlemen and underwear for them, buying orange, banana, tomato, lettuce, locote, potato, onion. Purchasing cards for cell phones and fabrics for the manufacture of garments

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Сайёра  Рузиева трудолюбивая женщина. Замужем, заботливая мать 2 детей. Саёйра умеет шить национальные платья. Первый раз получив у нас кредит, она закупила различные виды тканей и сшила платья на продажу. Полученный кредит помог ей получить хорошую прибыль от реализации сшитых платьев. 
 Вот уже три года она шьет национальные платья, и продает их в рыночные дни. Обычно у нас рыночными днями считаются пятница и воскресенье. Остальные дни она посвящает шитью платьев.
Сейчас Сайёра хочет получить кредит, для того чтобы закупить ткани летнего сезона, сшить платья и продовать их на рынке. Платья на снимке, дело рук самой Сайёры.
 Муж Сайеры работает водителем маршрутного такси.
texts.en:
Sayora R. is a hardworking woman. She is married and is caring mother of 2 children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Sayora knows how to make traditional dresses. After obtaining a loan from us for the first time, she purchased various fabrics and made dresses for sale. That loan helped her to make a good profit from selling the dresses. Sayora has been making traditional dresses for three years. She sells them during market days, which are normally Friday and Sunday. She devotes the rest of the week to sewing dresses. Currently, Sayora wants to obtain a loan in order to purchase summer season fabrics, make dresses and sell them at the market. The dresses shown on the photograph were made by Sayora.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics for dress-making

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma C. M. is a member of the communal bank “Manos Maravillosas” (Marvellous Hands) and lives in the city of Pucallpa. She has a small cart from which she sells cooked foods such as french fries and hot dogs, fried chicken, hamburgers, and “juanes” (a rice dish typical of the region). Every evening Irma brings her cart out to the main road near her home to sell her meals. Irma’s two adult daughters (aged 20 and 21) help her with this business.

Irma has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2.5 years and plans to invest this loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles in new pots and food for her business.

Irma is separated from her husband and lives with her three children; the youngest is a 13-year-old son. All depend on her. Irma is very thankful to be working with Manuela Ramos. With the help of her loans from Manuela Ramos Irma has been able to expand her business, improve her home, and purchase many basic household items. Although Irma has health problems, she wants to continue working at her food cart at least until January in order to support one of her daughters through university. At that time she hopes her eldest daughter can take over most of the work so Irma can dedicate herself to a less strenuous job.

loans.use: Food and new pots for the business

loans.name: Jekafo 2 De Toura Kalaga Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JEKAFO 2  est  constitué de femmes mariées du village de Toura Kalaga de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et   cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe JEKAFO 2 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe JEKAFO 2 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35 000 à 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The JEKAFO 2 group is made of married women of the Toura Nabitokan village, in the city of SAN (Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in traditional families. They average 35 years of age and 4 children. They grow peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the JEKAFO 2 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, exclusively at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the JEKAFO 2 group count on turning a profit of XOF 35000 to 25000 (ca US$ 78 to 55) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Needs Help Group

texts.en: Georgia is a 7th grade drop-out, married with 6 children. For the period of 10 years, Georgia has been involved in a tabletop marketing business which allowed her to send her children to school until the completion of high school. Georgia is dreaming of educating all of her children and providing good medical attention for all of them.

loans.use: buying bags of rice, gallons of oil, etc. for retail sale

loans.name: Komi Wowuena

texts.fr: Cet homme ayant le sens des affaires exerce depuis 2005 au grand marché de Lomé le commerce de mèches.Il exerce cette activité réservée exclusivement aux femmes et c'est ce qui fait sa particularité. C'est pourquoi il a beaucoup de clients qui sont curieux de venir acheter chez lui .Il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour l’achat de 30 cartons de mèches de hautes qualité et 15 de qualité moyenne.
texts.en:
Komi Wowuena K. is a born businessman who sells hair extensions at the Great Market in Lomé. This is a trade carried out exclusively by women, which is why he attracts a lot of attention. Many customers are keen to see this particular man and buy from him. Komi applies to WAGES for a loan to buy 30 boxes of high-quality and 15 boxes of medium-quality hair extensions.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions

loans.name: Berta Noemí

texts.es: Berta Noemí Q. D. G. resiD. en el municipio D. Armenia en el departamento D. Sonsonate.  Vive junto a su esposo, hijos y un nieto D. 4 años D. edad, que estudia su educación básica. Berta maneja un negocio D. venta D. ropa en el mercado D. Armenia, y es con los ingresos D. este negocio, con lo que mantiene a su extensa familia. Berta solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería para aumentar las ventas D. su negocio y poder proveer a su familia D. una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Berta Noemí Q. D. G. lives in the municipality of Armenia in the department of Sonsonate. She lives with her husband, children and a grandson, who is 4 years old and is in primary school. Berta manages a clothing business in the market in Armenia. With the income from this business, she takes care of her large family. Berta is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise to increase her sales and so that she can proviD. her family with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply new products to her business

loans.name: Fedelita

texts.en:
Fedelita S., 32 years old, owns and manages a small rice field in their village. She is one of the people who supplies rice to rice traders in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. The income she makes from growing rice is what she uses to buy food, clothes, and other basic needs at home.

She would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the needed materials to improve her harvest. She said that receiving this loan is truly helpful since she doesn't know where to get cash to pay the laborers who help till her farm and buy farming necessities.

She has just started as a CEVI client. She likes the program and wishes to access more loans in the future.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth for her business

loans.name: Tô's Group

texts.en:
Nụ Tô Thị (20213010019) is a 38-year-old woman who lives in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Nụ is the leader of a 5-member loan group sponsored by SEDA. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is An Ninh 1 (5).


Nụ is married and has 4 school-aged children. To making a living, Nụ owns and operates a recycling business where she hauls away plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Nụ has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Nụ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nụ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND that she will use to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. This will be Nụ's third loan from SEDA. Nụ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family members.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1. Nguyễn Thị H. (20213010016) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


2. Vũ Thị H. (20213010017) is a 46-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.


3. Đào Thị Thư (20213010018) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.


4. Nguyễn Thị L. (20213010021) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her clothing business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nụ Tô Thị (20213010019) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Nụ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là An Ninh 1 (5).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chuyên chở các sản phẩm có thể tái chế bằng nhựa hay các sản phẩm có thể tái chế khác cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nụ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nụ kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Nụ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nụ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua phế liệu bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20213010016) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  Vũ Thị H. (20213010017) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  Đào Thị Thư (20213010018) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20213010021) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic B. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 33 years old. Marivic is married and has 3 school-aged children. Marivic has been selling vegetables and spices in the local community for more than 5 years, and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (about $171 US) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marivic joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 pesos from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 12,000 pesos which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marivic from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 40 years old and married with five children. She is a hard working woman. Her children are doing well in their trade and school. She sells colorful sarongs at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customer. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Ishongororo Twekundire Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
B. Loy is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 50 years old and a very hard working, determined, and happy lady with a farming business in Ishongororo from where she is able to make 80,000 Ugandan shillings (about $27 US) as profits a month. She ensures that she has quality products and she hopes to have a modern farm in the future since she also has a kraal (corral) of cows and goats at her homestead.

Loy is married with six children, all of whom dropped out of secondary school, and she takes care of four dependants, including paying their school fees. She hopes to have her dependants attain the best education--more than what her own children have. She needs a loan to help expand her business by buying more farm inputs for better production.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Amina

texts.fr:
Madame Amina D.  est membre de la caisse de Camberene de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2001.
Elle a déjà  bénéficié d’un prêt qu’elle a rembourse correctement. Elle  est mariée  et mère  de 4 enfants .Elle a longtemps évolue  dans le commerce et spécialisée dans la vente de tissus et d’articles divers .C’est une femme ambitieuse qui veut gagner sa vie pour se procurer des revenus personnels. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi par amour. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs pour acheter des tissus et surtout des thioubs  dans le but de diversifier ses produits. Le  crédit  me permet d’accroître mon fond de roulement  et de renouveler continuellement mes marchandises car mes clients  achètent  à crédit.

Madame D. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs
texts.en:
Ms. Amina D. has been a member of the Camberene bank of U-IMCEC since January, 2001.  She has already benefited from a loan, which she repaid properly.  She is married and the mother of four children.  For quite awhile, she has been advancing in commerce and has specialized in selling cloth and a variety of goods.  She is an ambitious woman who wants to earn her living to have her own personal income.  Her business is one that she chose out of love.  She's requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy some cloth and especially  thioubs (damask fabrics) with the goal of diversifying her goods.  "The loan is allowing me to increase my operating fund and to replenish my merchandise continually because my customers buy on credit."  Ms. D. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Programme de développement de l'infant et de la famille(PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF (a development program for children and families) seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially to protect children who come from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can take advantage of loans having more flexible terms compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement’s start in December 2008, there have been 120 parents who received financing in amounts varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Teresita Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Teresita, inicia su segundo ciclo con 15 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comidas, abarrotes en general, leña, verduras, frutas, ropas.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Martha que es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Martha tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, además se dedica a L. agricultura en sus tierras D. L. selva.

Mientras que Diana es soltera, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Diana venD. productos D. belleza por catalogo sus ventas son al por mayor y menor. Diana tiene proyectado aperturar un restaurante.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 1050 soles  haciendo un total D. 8,550 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, papeles, leña, carne, ropa variada, frutas, verduras. 

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un negocio propio, aumentar sus ingresos y comprar mas exhibidores para su tienda.
texts.en:
The Community Bank Teresita begins its second cycle with 15 members. The members have different businesses such as food sales, general store, firewood, vegetables, fruits and clothing. As an example, Martha lives with her partner, is 36 and has four children, her general store is in her house and she sells general merchandise, vegetables, meat, she also works in agriculture in her lands located in the jungle. Diana on the other hand, is single, 30, has two children and sells beauty products through catalog, her sales are both retail and wholesale. Diana has a project to open a restaurant. The members need different loan amounts in soles currency such as $300, $600, and $1,050 for a total of $8,550 soles in loans from the Community Bank. Their loans will be invested in purchasing rice, sugar, paper, firewood, meat, assorted clothing, fruits, vegetables. The members’ dreams are that their children become professionals, have a business of their own, increase their income and purchase more displayers for their store.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, paper, firewood, meat, assorted clothing, fruits, vegetables

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mrs. Saret M., age 30, (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Choeun Kong, age 30, live along National Road Number Six about 18 km from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have two sons. Both of their sons are in school.  She also has a nephew living with her. 

Saret and her husband have just started renting a rice threshing machine to earn fees. They rent their rice threshing machine to the villagers. The couple hopes to expand their business, so Saret is asking for her first loan of US$1,000 in order to purchase an additional rice threshing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a rice threshing machine.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 34 years old, married with two children, and lives in the province of Rizal with her husband.  Her husband is involved in fishing and works as a welder to support the family.  Her two children attend the local elementary school in the community.

To supply additional income for her family, Jennifer would like to receive a loan to start a new food-selling business.  With the loan, she will purchase inventory for her snack store including hamburgers, rice, eggs, sugar, and fish.   She believes that offering a wide variety of delicious snacks will attract loyal customers in the neighborhood and attract a steady flow of patrons during the afternoon.

As a new member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Jennifer is grateful for access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Jennifer is hopeful that her new business endeavor will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To start a new food selling business.

loans.name: Jamalladin

texts.en:
Jamalladin Q. is a very loving father who is devoted to the needs of his children whom he adores. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children.

Jamalladin works raising livestock and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals but in order to do this he must purchase livestock of better breeds, and these animals are very costly.

Jamalladin needs working capital of 1,600 AZN, and at the moment he does not have that much money. Therefore, he is requesting this loan. He counts on you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 35 años D. edad tiene tres hijos uno D. 16 años, D. 12 años y 1 año el más pequeño, ella vive en la Maica central es un cantón D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba al sud D. nuestra ciudad Ana es una mujer trabajadora se dedica a la producción D. leche.

Ana es una mujer que sufrió desD. niña con el desamor D. su madre ya que solo eran dos hermanas las cuales hacia diferencia entre las dos ella era la menor D. las dos  ella termino sola el bachillerato en un colegio D. barrio y la hermana en cambio siempre estudio en colegios caros en el centro D. la ciudad ella dice que esas cosas hacen daño sentimental. Ana no siente rencor por sus padres pero si está segura que ella jamás aria eso con sus hijos, ella termino una carrera técnica pero no la ejerce porque siempre está con sus hijos y ella trabaja en su casa con la producción D. leche y D. la misma manera realiza quesillos que luego los hace entrega a una señora y los pueda vender ella no espera el sueldo del marido ella sale sola adelante siempre trabajando y ayudando en la educación a sus hijos y colaborando con el cuidado a su padre al ser mayor él tiene problemas D. salud y es la que se hace cargo D. llevarlo al doctor cuidarlo.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar  una cabeza D. ganado y D. esa manera aumentara su producción D. leche y realizara mas quesillos y tendrá mayores ingresos y segura apoyando a sus hijos para que puedan terminar el colegio y poder estudiar una carrera y ella se siente feliz D. estar con ellos en todos sus momentos libres esta es la historia D. Ana.
texts.en:
Señora Ana is 35 years of age and has three children, ages 16 years, 12 years and the smallest is 1 year. She lives in the Maica central, which is a neighborhood of the city of Cochabamba to the south. Ana is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to the production of milk. Ana is a woman that suffered as a girl with the disaffection of her mother, since there were only two sisters which were treated differently. She was the younger and only finished a degree in the neighborhood school, while the other sister always studied in expensive schools in the center of the city. She says that those things do sentimental damage. Ana does not feel a grudge against her parents but is sure that she would never do that with her children. She earned a technical degree but does not practice it because she is always with her children. She works from her house producing milk and also making cheeses that she then delivers and sells to a lady. She does not rely on the salary of a husband. She goes on alone, always working and helping in the education of her children and collaborating in the care of her father. Since he is old, he has health problems and she is the one who takes charge of taking him to the doctor. She needs the loan to buy a head of cattle and in that way enlarge her production of milk and make more cheese. In this way she will have greater income and sure support for her children so that they can finish school and study for a career. She feels happy to be with them in all her free time. This is the story of Ana.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a head of dairy cattle.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: As a mother, Dolores’s dreams are always for her children and family. She wants to bring her children into a decent life. During her almost four years in ASHI, she has shown herself to be industrious and determined to make her dreams come true. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in hopes to have secured access to capital for the continuation of her dying business. Her previous loans were carefully utilized as additional and rolling capital for her sari-sari store (a small retail store selling different goods). She is very determined and disciplined to use the money which is lent to her. Now on her 8th loan, Dolores proposes a loan of 25,000 pesos as additional working capital for her store. Specifically, the amount will be used to pay for inventories of groceries for her store. Dolores is hopeful that her business will grow into a full-fledge mini-grocery store and that someday she will have branches in nearby villages. Dolores also dreams of sending all her grandchildren to school until college and that they find jobs. One of her aspirations is to be able to build a house that is durable and spacious.

loans.use: To pay for inventory of groceries for her store.

loans.name: Christine Wanjiru

texts.en:
Christine is a 69-year-old farmer. She is a single mother of three sons and one daughter. 

She was introduced to KADET through an existing KADET client. She has been farming for the past five years. Christine plans to buy a chaff cutter and animal feeds with the loan. She sells her farm produce to hotel businesses and other small-scale farmers. She intends to expand her business and open a retail shop for selling animal feeds with the extra profit expected from her farming business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be an international distributor of her products and to educate her children to the university level. She describes herself as a hardworking lady, a born-again Christian and an honest and development-oriented farmer.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter and animal feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Gyedie Mu Aba Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Timothy describes himself as very hard-working. He is 44 years old and he is the leader of the “Gyedie mu aba” (translated as 'Seed of Faith') borrower group. Timothy is a manufacturer of local soap popularly known as ‘Azuma's blow’ because it looks like the blow of the renowned Ghanaian boxer called Azuma Nelson. The soap is prepared by combining materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil and hardener. The soap can be used for bathing and washing. It is relatively affordable and much patronized in the rural communities. Timothy has operated the business for the past three years. He is excited to be taking out this loan, which he plans to use to purchase ingredients for soap making.

Timothy is married to a woman who is a farmer and he is the father of two children. The other members of Timothy’s group sell footwear, peanuts, maize and 'kenkey' (a traditional fermented maize dish).  They plan to invest the loan to purchase inventory in bulk to grow their businesses. They hope to make more savings to be able to provide good education for all their children.

loans.use: To purchase soap ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 32 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Analyn grows rice for selling. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 14 years now. Analyn joined CEVI in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid previous loans from CEVI and is now requesting a her 8th loan from CEVI, for 15000 PHP, to purchase additional seed, fertilizer, and other farming equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional seed, fertilizer, and other farming equipment.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Mr. P., 39 years old, is a villager living in the province Battambang, in the north of Cambodia. He is married and blessed with two young school-aged children. His wife appears in the photo; she sells a few groceries to generate a daily income. P. owns a motorcycle that he uses to provide a taxi service around his community. P. sees that the grocery-selling business his wife operates is profitable for his family, and he hopes to improve it through assistance from Kiva.

loans.use: To improve the grocery-selling business.

loans.name: Elgie

texts.en: Elgie B. is a single woman who lives in Manghilao, Barangay Masaba, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating an abaca (fiber from abaca palm leaf used for handicraft production) weaving business. Elgie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elgie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,200, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase more products used for her abaca weaving business so that she could continue to save up for the future and help the family by improving their living conditions. Elgie B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team page and become a part of our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Lila y lo que mas le agrada es la facilidad de los prestamos.
Maria es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos que estudian y ella sola es quien se encarga de la mantención de sus hijos, Maria viaja a la selva ayacuchana y ferias en donde verduras surtidas y de allá compra leña que vende en la puerta de su casa.
Maria solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña de los productores.
Maria sueña con que sus hijos salgan adelante, tener casa propia porque vive en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Lila” (Lilac) communal bank. What she likes best are the easy loan terms. María is a single mother of five children who are students. She alone is responsible for their support. María travels into the Ayacucho backcountry and to farmers markets where she sells assorted vegetables. She brings back firewood that she then resells at her doorstep. María is asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy firewood from the producers. María dreams with having her own house because she currently lives in her parents’ house. She also hopes that her children succeed. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood from producers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Producing and selling palm oil

loans.name: Desiree Gay

texts.en:
Desiree Gay G., from the village of Brgy. Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya, is 20 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Desiree Gay owns and operates a business venture offering tricycle transport services. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Desiree Gay joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle to provide for better service, Desiree Gay plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Toirchon

texts.ru: Абдурасулов Тоирчон проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 28 лет. Холост. Образование среднее. Занимается перевозкой людей, то есть предоставляет услугу, такси. Он в основном развозит людей по маршруту Хамадони - Душанбе, Душанбе - Хамадони. В этой области уже 4 года. Кредит берет для приобретения новой автомашины.
texts.en: Toirchon A. lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 28 years old, single.  He has a secondary education.  Toirchon is involved in passenger transportation, i.e. he provides taxi service.  He primarily transports people on the Hamadoni-Dushanbe, Dushanbe-Hamadoni route.  Toirchon has been in this field for 4 years.  He is requesting this loan in order to purchase a new car.

loans.use: Purchase of a new car

loans.name: María Olga

texts.es:
María Olga es una madre de familia de 48 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Chepén, una zona de regular movimiento comercial que es la capital de la provincia del mismo nombre y que se encuentra situada en la región La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares. Adicionalmente cría animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio con la finalidad de venderlos a los negociantes que con frecuencia visitan la zona en donde vive.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más artículos para su bodega, de este modo ella espera aumentar sus ventas y percibir un mayor número de ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles con los cuales espera lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer emprendedora y que siempre se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su familia. Sus clientes y vecinos la consideran una mujer de trato amable y servicial.
texts.en:
Maria Olga is a mom, she is 48 years old and she lives together with her husband and their two children in the agricultural district of Chepen, a commercial region from the capital city in the province of the same name. It is located in La Libertad, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

She has a general store from where she sells every day items and groceries. The store is located in a section of her home. With this business she is able to contribute with her husband towards the family's expenses. She also raises small farm animals behind their home until they are eventually sold to the merchants that visit the region where they live. 

Maria wishes to expand her business and to purchase more inventory for her store. She will be able to increase her sales and see an improvement in her profits. To this end she has requested a first time loan of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles.  With the help of this loan she will reach her goal. 

She is an enterprising woman and she has always found the strength to provide for her family.  Her clients and her neighbors know her to be a very kind and helpful person.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en:
Sergelen is 44 years old, and he lives with his wife and 2 sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His eldest son Tserenpuntsag, is 9 and attends a local secondary school. His youngest son Tuvshinbayar, is 2 years old and stays at home with his mum. 

Mr. Sergelen's wife Tuul operates sewing business at home while Sergelen operates a taxi business in the city. Sergelen is hard working person and is known for his friendly character. He likes his business and enjoys transporting people.  His dream is to have their own family house and to give a proper education for their kids. He has gained a lot of experience over the years and is a trusted driver for his many customers. The loan he is requesting will be used to improve his living condition and to buy some furniture.

loans.use: to improve family's living condition and to buy some furniture

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es: Luz es una mujer luchadora que hace mas de 5 años emprendió el negocio de vender comida, con su deliciosa sazón  diariamente vende ceviche en la puerta de su casa por las mañanas y por las tardes vende frituras como salchipapas. Eso no es todo, a lo largo de este tiempo comercializa  prendas de vestir que trae desde Tacna. Una de sus cuñadas le incentivo a realizar negocios y a sus 49 años Luz ha logrado  ampliar su vivienda y aportar para el pago del colegio de su último hijo que tiene 14 años. El préstamo será invertido en mercaderías nuevas como juguetes u otros para vender esta campaña navideña próxima. Luz está orgullosa de poder obtener y pagar puntualmente sus créditos en Edaprospo.
texts.en:
Luz is a fighter who has been in business selling food for more than 5 years.
